Description:
Are you a Data Engineer who is ready to challenge yourself in using state-of-the-art technology to democratize e-commerce and create more technological equality?
Custimy is on the mission to create the Next-Generation Customer Data Platform for all. We are building the right infrastructural software required to activate valuable customer data for everyone. And, by everyone, we mean to empower smaller E-commerce businesses to have the same opportunities as larger ones for customer attention, acquisition and loyalty.
To support our rocket growth, we’re looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our fast-paced and exciting engineering team. You will become an integral part of shaping our Development team, focused on creating the next generation Customer Data Platform. As we are still a new company you will have a lot of impact on the development and the success journey of our start-up.

Lead Instrument Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Instrument Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Instrument Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Work activities will include both project and proposal work where both the technical approach and continuity must be aligned
Work activities for both projects and proposals will be executed across all phases of projects including Conceptual Studies; Basic; FEED; Detailed Design; Procurement through to Commissioning.
Projects and proposals are for process plant and facilities across the Power and Energy Transition/ New Energy sectors
Project work will include development of Instrument Engineering deliverables as required on a project by project basis
Project work as the functional Lead Engineer for projects as required by the C&I Group Manager


Degree qualified for the related discipline
Chartered Engineer status as a Member of the Institute of Measurement and Control (IMC) or Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).
20+ years’ experience Instrument Engineering
5 + years’ experience in a Lead role on capital projects from concept to start-up
Experience of working in a client facing large project group environment
Very good proactive communicator.
Experienced at controlling man-hour budgets and scheduled delivery
Proven ability for equipment specification and selection and in ensuring compliance from the suppliers, preferably within an EPC contracting organization
Is this Lead Instrument Engineer position a good fit for you? Get in touch with us today.

The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert.

Job_title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer, FinTech Remote
Description:
ViaBill operates at the intersection of the eCommerce, payments and consumer credit sectors, and is an industry pioneer and early market entrant in the BNPL industry, which is experiencing rapid growth. Becoming the best at something isn’t easy. It takes skill, hard work, and an unmatched level of ambition and determination. Our team is international, experienced and most of all, hardworking. In just a few years, we’ve grown from our first office in an art gallery in Denmark to having our teams located all over the globe.
From a handful of customers to handling transactions worth more than $150M per year, we aren’t afraid of new challenges and new markets. Our strategy has been validated with external investment from leading VCs Headline and BlackFin Capital Partners.

About The Role

Description:
Overview:
Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

Description:
Lead Structural Engineer – Renewable Energy – 12 Month Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Senior Structural Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to support a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Structural Engineer with a degree in a relevant engineering discipline from April 2023. As the Lead Structural Engineer, you will join the Civil, Structural, Architectural and Weight Control department. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Implement discipline improvements
Complete discipline audits and technical peer reviews
Maintain the required technical quality of work
Identify scope and schedule changes in accordance with the Change Control Process
Ensure that designs comply with the relevant procedures and regulations
Ensure as far as is practically possible, that all assigned work is carried out in compliance with agreed budget and schedule
Prepare estimates and schedules and assist in their review
Maintain good communication with the client and visit sites when necessary
Encourage and provide lateral learning within the project
Commit to and promote Worley values and ensure the realisation of company and project health, safety, environmental, quality and ethics, systems, policies and procedures


Degree in Engineering
Senior Project Management experience
Hydrogen, Power, Waste or Fuel industry experience
Greenfield project experience, from site selection through to delivery
Does this Lead Structural Engineer role sound like a great fit for you? We want to hear from you. Apply today.

Description:
Lead Electrical Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Electrical Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Electrical Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Manage electrical engineering services that meet our client’s and its customers' and applicable statutory and regulatory specifications, on time and within budget.
Manage electrical engineering project requirements.


participate in relevant meetings, prepare progress reports and comply with required checking procedures;
ensure the project scope is clear and that changes comply with project change management processes;
provide advice during procurement, construction and commissioning activities. For example, oversee requisitions, technical bid evaluations and purchase order preparation.

Communicate effectively with the electrical engineering team and project stakeholders, including the Customer.
Identify issues and problems, develop appropriate solutions, and ask for assistance when required.


Relevant engineering degree.
Chartered Professional Engineer (CPEng) status.
Relevant postgraduate qualifications in engineering; management, project management or supervisory qualifications or equivalent.
Excellent IT skills
Excellent technical and practical engineering skills and ability to consistently deliver quality, accurate and timely work to with our client and its clients.
Excellent knowledge of the fundamental requirements of the electrical engineering
Excellent knowledge of applicable local and international standards and regulatory specifications.

Description:
The security organization at Uber is dedicated to enabling safe and secure innovation while protecting the communities we serve both online and in the physical world. Our teams are responsible for protecting both people and their data across intersections of the digital and physical world. The primary objective for Uber Engineering Security team is to enable the technical ambitions of the company while maintaining the highest standards of security and privacy for our customers and partners. As cybersecurity threats evolve, so do we.
About the Role
Uber is seeking a Security Engineer II to join our Product Security Team. In this role your principal mission will be to drive security-related engineering engagement and technical remediation across our product lines, supporting our vulnerability management, application security, and cloud security teams to scale security engagement across Engineering.

Job_title: Data Engineer for Research Data Management
Description:
Location: Denmark : Hoersholm
Country: Denmark

We are looking for a curious and dedicated scientific Data Engineer to contribute to our efforts in defining, building and securing our research data management standards to leverage the usage and context of our research data.
The position is placed in our Research Data Management team, which is part of Chr. Hansen’s newly established R&D Digital Innovation function located at the company’s headquarter in Hørsholm, Denmark.

Your new team
As our new scientific Data Engineer you will get the opportunity to join a team of highly skilled and passionate people working on streamlining the acquisition and transformation of our research data, while ensuring their data integrity and security.

Description:
Linkfire is looking for a full-time Data Engineer in Copenhagen, Lisbon or remote (EMEA) to support our missions to create value through data. You will join us to continue discovering and delivering new and exciting features for the 150+ million fans which we bring closer to their favorite artists every month.
You will join a company with roots and heart in music. We're a team of designers, engineers, product managers and more, drawn from every corner of the globe.
Our goal? Empowering entertainment discovery everywhere!

What you will do at Linkfire

Are you looking to join a dynamic, international company looking to change the world of finance?
Are you a problem solver with strong analytical capabilities?
Then you’re in the right place!
Inpay is recruiting an Analytics Engineer, who will report to our Head of Data Analytics & BI. You will be joining the Data Analytics & BI team as well as other internal stakeholders. We are looking for a data-driven profile who can take our data modelling and documentation to the next level.
Your primary tasks will be:
Supporting Inpay in becoming data driven by helping establish a Data Analytics & BI Center of Excellence
Drive adoption of our Data Platform, which currently consists of Fivetran, dbt Cloud, Snowflake, and PowerBI

Job_title: Student Intern - Road Engineer for COWI in Odense, Denmark
Description:
Application deadline: 09 May 2023 - Denmark - Location: Odense - Infrastructure & Transportation

Student Intern – Road engineer for COWI in Odense, Denmark
Odense

Do you want to be a part of a leading international consulting company that creates value and solutions to some of the most complex issues worldwide? Are you a Chartered Engineer looking to advance your career in transportation? Then this is the place to apply your knowledge and curiosity to enable a better tomorrow.

Create Solutions that will enable a better tomorrow
The road section in Odense consists of 20 dedicated road engineers who work on projects within everything between path and road construction, cross conversions, site development and large international projects such as data centers, wind turbine projects, power to X - always with a focus on the green transition. As an intern, you will be part of an environment with high professionalism, team spirit and a great social commitment. You will be involved in the projects on an equal footing with other project engineers and gain insight into what it is like to be a consulting engineer. You will take part in turning challenges into sustainable solutions while kickstarting your career in a friendly and collaborative work environment.


Think smart solutions within the road area on projects from urban development projects, over open country projects, to large national and international projects
Design and supervision of land development, path projects, roundabouts, intersections, highways, data centers and large industrial projects
Focus on border dispute coordination with other disciplines both internally and externally
Think digitalization and sustainability into our projects

We highly value our interns and view them as aspiring future experts; We expect that you can work at the office as much as possible. Working from home is possible when agreed with your manager.
COWI is a leader within our field because our employees are leaders within theirs. We invite you to learn from the best and expand your potential in an outstanding environment, where we collaborate on shaping tomorrow's societies. Alongside your manager, you outline the path for your development and build your expertise on a day-to-day basis, working on global and local assignments.

Your skills. Our team. Together we design the future.
The first step to success in this role is that you are eager to collaborate with the people around you, whether they are colleagues, partners, or customers. Developing ties with others is something you do by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve. To succeed in this position, we believe that you should be a team player with curiosity, courage and care.
Furthermore, we imagine that you meet the following qualifications:

Study Civil Engineering
Have Interest within roads, transport planning in general
The ability to collaborate with and develop strong business relationships with people inside and outside COWI across professional disciplines
A high personal drive, high integrity, is systematic, result-oriented and proactive
Novapoint, InRoads, OpenRoads, Civil3D or MicroStation
Should be proficient in communicating in English (Written and Verbal) and any other Scandinavian language

A place to work and so much more
At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity – and sometimes even our courage – to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100 per cent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.
We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.
With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America, and India, we are currently 7,300 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy, and environment into play.

Got more questions?
If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please reach out to Tine Lillesø Larsen, head of Section tlln@cowi.com.
Get to know us even better at our website, www.cowi.com, where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.

Equal opportunity employer
COWI provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, COWI complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Description:
We are Lightnovo, a start-up company established in 2019 and founded by DTU researchers Oleksii Ilchenko, Yurii Pilhun, and Anja Boisen. Our vision is to become the leading developer and provider of Raman spectroscopy and Raman microscopy solutions for research-grade, industrial and consumer applications.
We are looking for an experienced C++ Software Engineer to join our team for the full-time.
The ideal candidate is expected to be comfortable developing C++ Desktop Applications in Qt for Windows 10, being familiar with designing programs for controlling external hardware, able to debug both hardware and software.
Responsibilities:

As a purpose-driven company with a heritage of leading shipping companies, we build and deliver a groundbreaking SaaS solution to change the shipping industry through digitalisation. We strive to help our customers optimise their business while reducing CO2 emissions. This is what empowers us.
Today, we are 150+ employees and more than 38 nationalities spread across offices in Copenhagen HQ, Athens, Varna, Mumbai, Singapore and New York City.

With a recent Series B capital raise of +$50 Mil, we are in a position to challenge the status quo. We proudly support the industry’s green transition and enable our customers to turn data into immediate decarbonisation actions.

What does it mean to be a Machine Learning Engineer at ZeroNorth?

Description:
In our line of work, life isn’t a given - it’s the ultimate goal. When life takes an unexpected turn, our technology and solutions enable caregivers to make informed diagnostic decisions to improve patient care. This is our shared purpose at Radiometer and what unites all +4000 of us - no matter our roles or where in the world we’re located. Creating impactful innovations like ours, doesn’t happen overnight - it requires uncompromising persistency, passion, and a desire to make a difference. Here, you can learn, grow, and chart an uncommonly diverse career.
Radiometer is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.
The Systems Engineer in Immunoassay R&D is responsible for applying chemical knowledge, systems engineering processes and skills to develop system solutions within technical, schedule and cost constraints.

Description:
Our Data team is growing and we’re looking for an Analytics Engineer, a Data Engineer, and a Data Manager to join our team for continued development and improvement on the overall Data Strategy, how we manage data today, and most importantly, how we make data understandable for the organization.
At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. We have grown by leaps and bounds since starting out in Aarhus in 2015 and are now considered a major player in the Nordics with offices in Aarhus, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Oslo, as well as employees working remotely across Europe.
As a Data Manager, you will be responsible for articulating and formalizing the Lunar data strategy and governance, acting as a key senior advisor to data accountable c-suite representatives with the aim to ensure the right level of data quality, meeting legal and regulatory obligations, and to drive new business opportunities.

Job_title: Data Engineers and Data Analysts for Copenhagen
Description:
Data Engineers & Data Analysts
My client is known to go above and beyond to help organizations to start using Artificial Intelligence, Analytics, and Data. They have even developed their own AlaaS platform that gives consumers the edge through the power of data-driven insights.
Here you will be surrounded by other Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Front end Developers and you will be part of a start-up mentality with agile ways of working. Teamwork is seen all over the office and always leads to delivering success.
My client is now looking for new talents to join the team. They are looking for someone with experience in building data warehouse infrastructure in Cloud and someone that understands the data mesh concept. My client has multiple data sources that need to be converted into data models, connected to each other, and provided for both visual tools like Power BI, and advanced analytics like Machine Learning, and also made available for consumption via API´s.

Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Description:
Our Data team is growing, and we’re looking for an Analytics Engineer, a Data Engineer, and a Data Manager to join our team for continued development and improvement on the overall Data Strategy, how we manage data today, and most importantly, how we make data understandable for the organization.
At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. We have grown by leaps and bounds since starting out in Aarhus in 2015 and are now considered a major player in the Nordics with offices in Aarhus, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Oslo, as well as employees working remotely across Europe.
As we’re moving closer to our Moon Landing strategy we’re looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our Data warehouse team (currently a team of 5), report to our Head of Data Warehouse Wojciech Witowski, and help us leverage data to drive innovation and growth. As an Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and implementing data analytics solutions, as well as maintaining and optimizing existing analytics systems.

Description:
Do you like working with a variety of tasks, while always having a focus on developing high level technical solutions? Are you looking for a place where you explore and develop your skills in fields like code libraries, data pipelines and IaC. Does teamwork with daily discussions and input motivate you?
Then this job is the right one for you.
The Copenhagen Metro (Metroselskabet I/S) is looking for an experienced Data Engineer/Backend developer to join our DataLake team in the department of Digitalization and Technology. We expect that you are competent with designing, architecting, as well as developing solutions for a DataLake. We are using Google Cloud and want to strengthen the setup as well as build up an API-capability to receive data.
The DataLake already has several data sources but is going to increase this number over the coming years. Currently Data Lake includes data on KPI-measurement, automating data-triggered processes as well as advanced data analytics. In the future we want to include several IoT sources, build a data-driven ESG-reporting setup, utilize ML related to predictive maintenance, remove tedious tasks in business unit with data-driven automated support as well as start to use streaming data.

Description:
We are one of the fastest-growing podcast and audiobook platforms in Europe and we are now looking for an ambitious Analytics Engineer to join our growing Data team. Come and join us on our journey to enrich lives through listening.

This is the role
In this position, you will become part of our small, yet ambitious BI & Analytics Engineering team, which is part of our global Data department. The team is responsible for developing and maintaining our company-wide data platform and works to enable data-driven decision-making across the entire organization.

You will be at the heart of the collaboration between data analysts, scientists, engineers, and business teams, and will be responsible for bringing efficient and robust data models, BI interfaces, and self-service solutions to life.

The team offers a casual atmosphere with great opportunities to grow and make an impact, and you will in this position get the chance to play a leading role in shaping and driving our data modeling efforts.

Job_title: Energy analyst with a flair for data
Description:
Ea Energy Analyses is looking for a new colleague with a background in energy systems analyses and an understanding of energy systems, technologies, markets, and/or the energy regulatory environment. Someone who wants to be a part of an ambitious company that makes analyses with an impact on the energy transition in Denmark and globally.
Your primary tasks
Your primary tasks will be to work with a broad spectrum of projects addressing current and future energy system challenges. This includes using technical and economic scenario modelling, data manipulation and quantitative analysis. Examples of specific tasks include:
Engaging in energy system analyses – could be at international, national, subnational down to plant level.

Create the future – Grow with Arla

We are moving the majority of our data analytical work into a Hub & Spoke model and are looking for a number of skilled and experienced data engineers to join our agile release train covering marketing and innovation in Arla IT (The Spoke). You will be part of delivering the analytics developments with tools, processes and support with direction from The Centre of Excellence (The Hub). You will join a team of Solution Consultants, Architects, Test Managers, Developers and Scrum Masters as well as representatives from the business. We take good care of new employees and as newly hired, you will get a buddy that you can lean on in the first time in the new job.

Senior Engineers - Europe

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Eats | Aarhus, Denmark
Description:
About the Role
Whether it's a sandwich, a burrito, or groceries, the Uber Eats team builds technology to connect people with what they want, when and where they want it. The Eats Engineering team in Denmark is responsible for building the product catalog and inventory system that powers the Uber Eats experience and related verticals, such as groceries. This is one of the foundational components of the Eats architecture, as it interfaces with merchants, powers our local graph, and serves recommendations to our customers. The system is designed to be highly-available and highly-scalable to support our global operation.
What You'll Do
Sr Staff engineers at Uber have a deep impact across a wide variety of business and technology decisions spanning multiple projects and locations. They are passionate and pragmatic technologists who are able to design, implement and deliver scalable and resilient systems. They are not only collaborative role models, but also approachable leaders within a larger group. They are humble teachers, technically mentoring a team of dedicated engineers while also delivering uniquely challenging projects.

Description:
The security organization at Uber is dedicated to enabling safe and secure innovation while protecting the communities we serve both online and in the physical world. Our teams are responsible for protecting both people and their data across intersections of the digital and physical world. The primary objective for Uber Engineering Security team is to enable the technical ambitions of the company while maintaining the highest standards of security and privacy for our customers and partners. As cybersecurity threats evolve, so do we.
About the Role
Uber is seeking a Software Engineer II to join our Vulnerability Platform team. As a member of our team you will help us scale the traditional model of finding infrastructure vulnerabilities manually to a fully automated and autonomous system. In this role, you will be tasked with designing, implementing and deploying security automation solutions responsible for orchestration of vulnerability management workflows on all Uber’s infrastructure assets. As a Software Engineer on the Vulnerability Platform team you’ll leverage your SWE skills and security expertise to raise the security bar across production and enterprise environments at Uber. This is a unique opportunity to work with both senior and new-grad engineers, make a real impact on Uber’s security posture, and continue to up-level your own software engineering and security skills.

Description:
Monthio, a leading software development company, is revolutionizing the financial services industry with our groundbreaking B2B SaaS platform. Founded in 2018, we empower financial institutions to optimize their decision-making process for providing loans through state-of-the-art technology, unparalleled data analysis, and advanced transaction classification. Our passionate 44-member team is committed to delivering financial institutions a comprehensive and user-friendly understanding of their customers' financial situations.

The Role
We are seeking a talented and experienced Lead Engineer to join our dynamic team in Copenhagen, driving transformation within the financial services industry. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a real impact on the development of one of Denmark's most exciting fintech products. As we continue to expand, you will play a key role in refining our product, proactively addressing and minimizing technical debt, and leading our engineering team to success. You will oversee the creation, maintenance, and operation of our exceptional products while actively participating in personal and team growth.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Stateful Fleet Management
Description:
About the Role
We build Uber’s infrastructure to deploy and run all database engines and other stateful systems globally. Our mission at Uber is to run all storage solutions at scale, with high availability, low cost, and a high level of automation. All changes are automated (or self-healing) such as doing kernel upgrades, handling host failures, or expanding storage clusters.
About Us
We run around 100,000 hosts, millions of containers, and exabytes of storage across multiple geographical regions with availability zones in both Uber’s own data centers and multiple cloud vendors. Databases are containerized and co-located on hosts with intelligent placement to optimize utilization and failure domain anti-affinity to improve efficiency and consistency. Services are written in Go and All code changes are peer-reviewed.

Job_title: Sr Software Engineer, Stateful Container Management
Description:
About the Role
We build Uber’s infrastructure to deploy and run all database engines and other stateful systems such as MySQL, Schemaless, Redis, ZooKeeper, Kafka and HDFS globally for all of Uber worldwide. Our mission is to run all Uber's storage solutions at scale, with high-availability, low cost, and high level of automation. All changes are automated (or self-healing) such as doing kernel upgrades, handling host failures or expanding storage clusters.

A Bit About Us
We manage around 100,000 hosts, millions of containers and exabytes of storage across multiple geographical regions with availability zones in both Uber’s own data centers and multiple cloud vendors. Databases are dockerized and co-located on hosts with intelligent placement to optimize utilization and failure domain anti-affinity to maximize efficiency and reliability. Services are written in Go with a strong focus on clean, readable code with unit and integration test coverage. All code changes are peer-reviewed.

Description:
Teton is building technology that lets us all re-imagine the role of the healthcare worker.
The worldwide nursing shortage is currently crippling hospitals and care homes, and the new technologies will play a crucial role in saving the healthcare system from collapse. At Teton we operate differently than the traditional companies within the field, by having a relentless focus on the product and users and developing solutions in lightning speed. In 2 years, Teton has developed and commercialized a full fleshed AI product, used by health care worker everyday and covering more than 140 patient-rooms to date.

The job:
We are looking for a true builder with broad technical ambitions and a deep interest in AI. If you are interested in making high stake intelligent systems that people use everyday that have true impact, this is probably one of the best chances on danish ground. You will be working on our entire deep learning stack, experience how alive the system is and be digging deep into both code and data. Deploying real world AI system and getting them to work well is all about iterations and therefore we truly believe in having high iteration speed, meaning new models gets deployed every week to our fleet and what can be automated should be.

· Operate within standard operating procedures (SOPs) and safe work guidelines at Datacentre.
· Racking and Stacking
· Cabling (Network and Fiber Optics)
· Powering on/off the devices
· Visual Inspection of equipment in DC
Salary: 1,500.00kr. - 2,500.00kr. per day
Ability to commute/relocate:

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Fleet Reliability and Performance
Description:
About the Role
We build the foundations for all of Uber’s fleet of 100,000s of hosts or VMs by ensuring they are running optimally and are configured efficiently for the container platforms using the hosts. We observe and detect a broad range of reliability and quality problems through codified processes and automatically drive remediation.

We run generically across bare metal hosts and VMs and across our own on-prem data centers and multiple cloud vendors, and closely collaborate to develop integrations that ensure effective and automated management.

Internally we integrate with Uber’s stateful and stateless container scheduling platforms to run host operations in a safe and efficient way and use this to realize remediation of bad hosts or apply fleet-wide upgrades such as rolling out a new kernel.

Description:
”Her er en gylden mulighed for dig, der vil bruge din erfaring med data i en stor organisation, hvor anvendelsen af data bliver mere og mere afgørende. Du skal være med til at opbygge PFA’s nye kommercielle dataplatform, og du får masser af mulighed for at bruge dine innovative evner og arbejde med data i Cloud. Du bliver en del af et virkeligt godt team med masser af ping-pong, sparring og samarbejde,” siger Rasmus Dyhrberg, der er leder af Commercial Data i PFA.

Du skal være med til at revolutionere PFA’s brug af data
Du bliver del af teamet ’Commercial Data.’ Vi er i fuld gang med at etablere PFA’s fremtidige dataplatform i samarbejde med den øvrige dataorganisation. Teamets fokus er den kommercielle del af PFA, hvor data skal understøtte nye innovative løsninger til værdi for PFA og vores kunder. Den nye dataplatform bygges i Cloud og skal understøtte både analytiske og operationelle databehov. Derfor har vi fokus på optimal anvendelse af værktøjer og arkitektur samt discipliner som DevOps og DataOps for at sikre en agil, skalérbar og fremadskuende dataplatform. Du får en arbejdsdag, hvor du veksler mellem at fordybe dig i at udvikle dataløsninger med teamet og at mødes med interne kunder og interessenter for at afdække deres behov. Det kan fx være kolleger fra PFA’s rådgivningscenter eller kolleger, der arbejder med AI. Du er også med til at sætte retningen for teamet, vælge værktøjer og dele viden med dine kolleger.

Job_title: Sr Machine Learning Research Engineer @ Corti
Description:
Join us to play a critical role in changing healthcare for the better.
At Corti, we are growing fast and constantly looking for fresh talent to ensure we go in the right direction! If you enjoy working in a fun, autonomous, and collaborative team, guided by shared values and a willingness to act, iterate and learn…
…then join us at Corti as a Senior Machine Learning Research Engineer!
As a Machine Learning Research Engineer, you will be the essential bridge between Corti’s machine learning research division and our product teams. Our research division hosts several Ph.D. students and postdocs in collaboration with universities. Our product teams are cross-functional and own product discovery and delivery end-to-end. You can read more about our research and publications here.

Job_title: Vi søger en Data Engineer som vil være med
Description:
I Spar Nord arbejder vi målrettet med at udvikle vores arbejdsgange, med henblik på at skabe et effektivt maskinrum, til gavn for vores kunder og medarbejdere. Vil har et fedt team, og håber du vil med på holdet?
Lige nu søger Spar Nord IT, Business Intelligence (BI) en kollega som motiveres af at skabe gennemsigtighed med data pipelines som en del af vores data infrastruktur. Synes du at det er fedt at perspektivere på det samlede landskab og formidle værdikæden, så har du chancen nu, for at blive en del af en fantastisk afdeling og arbejdsplads.
En grundsten i bankens maskinrum er data, som vi dagligt lykkes med at udbygge i BI. I dag er data i høj grad anvendt i forretningsprocesser, hvortil vi i BI skal stille det bedst mulige grundlag til rådighed. BI er organiseret i flere scrum teams, som arbejder ud fra agile metoder. Dialog, samarbejde og viden om forretningen er en naturlig del af jobbet. Udviklingsopgaverne spænder bredt, og fælles for dem er, at de gør en forskel for forretningen. I samarbejde med 26 udviklerkolleger samt Product owners, Scrum masters og ledelse skal vi formå at rykke banken på data, hvilket vi bedst gør ved samarbejde med IT kolleger og øvrige forretningsenheder.

Cons: ['No Cons have been reported by the Glassdoor community.']

Description:
Data Engineer Director – Join Our Revolutionary Healthcare Data Insights program at Novo Nordisk

Are you a data engineer who is passionate about making a real impact on the healthcare industry? Do you dream of transforming the way clinical data is handled and shared across the business, with the potential to create value throughout the value chain? If you're excited about enabling real-time access and analysis of clinical data, including RCT, real-world data, multi-omics, images, streaming data, and more, then we have an opportunity you don´t want to miss.


We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer Director to join our team and help us become a global healthcare leader powered by data, analytics, and digital technologies. As a Data Engineer Director, you will play a critical role in building our state-of-the-art data insights platform, FounData, and developing outcomes and solutions that will transform the way we operate. You'll work alongside top talent in the industry and make a significant impact on the way we develop new medicines, improve quality, and create value for Novo Nordisk Development and Novo Nordisk at large.


The FounData program is a new R&D data insights initiative designed to enhance data storage, curation/handling, analysis, and visualizations relevant to the entire organization. This initiative is set to revolutionize the way we use data in decision-making by enabling data availability from a one-stop clinical data shop. To achieve this, we require robust data pipelines and data models across various data modalities. The program is anchored within Data Science in the Development organization in Novo Nordisk (NN), and we aim to create a solution that spans the value chain.

DE-forløbet består af oplæg og workshops, som er tilrettelagt, udviklet og afholdt af dine kommende kollegaer i Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence. Forløbet sikrer en effektiv og målrettet onboarding, så du hurtigt får hands-on-erfaring.
Alle teams arbejder agilt inden for SAFe og har et årshjul med fire PI’s. Hvert PI afsluttes med tre dages Hackathon, der giver mere end 140 medarbejdere med forskellige fagligheder mulighed for at samarbejde på tværs om selvvalgte projekter.

Job_title: Sr Software Engineer, Stateful Container Management
Description:
About the Role
We build Uber’s infrastructure to deploy and run all database engines and other stateful systems such as MySQL, Schemaless, Redis, ZooKeeper, Kafka and HDFS globally for all of Uber worldwide. Our mission is to run all Uber's storage solutions at scale, with high-availability, low cost, and high level of automation. All changes are automated (or self-healing) such as doing kernel upgrades, handling host failures or expanding storage clusters.

A Bit About Us
We manage around 100,000 hosts, millions of containers and exabytes of storage across multiple geographical regions with availability zones in both Uber’s own data centers and multiple cloud vendors. Databases are dockerized and co-located on hosts with intelligent placement to optimize utilization and failure domain anti-affinity to maximize efficiency and reliability. Services are written in Go with a strong focus on clean, readable code with unit and integration test coverage. All code changes are peer-reviewed.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Fleet Reliability and Performance
Description:
About the Role
We build the foundations for all of Uber’s fleet of 100,000s of hosts or VMs by ensuring they are running optimally and are configured efficiently for the container platforms using the hosts. We observe and detect a broad range of reliability and quality problems through codified processes and automatically drive remediation.

We run generically across bare metal hosts and VMs and across our own on-prem data centers and multiple cloud vendors, and closely collaborate to develop integrations that ensure effective and automated management.

Internally we integrate with Uber’s stateful and stateless container scheduling platforms to run host operations in a safe and efficient way and use this to realize remediation of bad hosts or apply fleet-wide upgrades such as rolling out a new kernel.

Description:
”Her er en gylden mulighed for dig, der vil bruge din erfaring med data i en stor organisation, hvor anvendelsen af data bliver mere og mere afgørende. Du skal være med til at opbygge PFA’s nye kommercielle dataplatform, og du får masser af mulighed for at bruge dine innovative evner og arbejde med data i Cloud. Du bliver en del af et virkeligt godt team med masser af ping-pong, sparring og samarbejde,” siger Rasmus Dyhrberg, der er leder af Commercial Data i PFA.

Du skal være med til at revolutionere PFA’s brug af data
Du bliver del af teamet ’Commercial Data.’ Vi er i fuld gang med at etablere PFA’s fremtidige dataplatform i samarbejde med den øvrige dataorganisation. Teamets fokus er den kommercielle del af PFA, hvor data skal understøtte nye innovative løsninger til værdi for PFA og vores kunder. Den nye dataplatform bygges i Cloud og skal understøtte både analytiske og operationelle databehov. Derfor har vi fokus på optimal anvendelse af værktøjer og arkitektur samt discipliner som DevOps og DataOps for at sikre en agil, skalérbar og fremadskuende dataplatform. Du får en arbejdsdag, hvor du veksler mellem at fordybe dig i at udvikle dataløsninger med teamet og at mødes med interne kunder og interessenter for at afdække deres behov. Det kan fx være kolleger fra PFA’s rådgivningscenter eller kolleger, der arbejder med AI. Du er også med til at sætte retningen for teamet, vælge værktøjer og dele viden med dine kolleger.

Teton is building technology that lets us all re-imagine the role of the healthcare worker.
The worldwide nursing shortage is currently crippling hospitals and care homes, and the new technologies will play a crucial role in saving the healthcare system from collapse. At Teton we operate differently than the traditional companies within the field, by having a relentless focus on the product and users and developing solutions in lightning speed. In 2 years, Teton has developed and commercialized a full fleshed AI product, used by health care worker everyday and covering more than 140 patient-rooms to date.

The job:
We are looking for a true builder with broad technical ambitions and a deep interest in AI. If you are interested in making high stake intelligent systems that people use everyday that have true impact, this is probably one of the best chances on danish ground. You will be working on our entire deep learning stack, experience how alive the system is and be digging deep into both code and data. Deploying real world AI system and getting them to work well is all about iterations and therefore we truly believe in having high iteration speed, meaning new models gets deployed every week to our fleet and what can be automated should be.

Job_title: Embedded Software Engineer - IoT Solutions - Denmark
Description:
Through the past two decades, Trackunit has been pushing digitalization within construction. Today, Trackunit is not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and driving the agenda for an entire industry. By continuously challenging the status quo, Trackunit is determined to eliminate downtime.
The question is: Are you in?
The way we will access data via mobile connectivity in our domain is facing a fundamental shift. Autonomous construction machines, constant connectivity and differentiated data needs gathered via multiple sources. Combined with the LTE & 5G promises on low latency, low cost, high data bandwidth, high security etc. is a potential major change on all the fundamental elements that makes up the device to cloud connectivity provided by Trackunit.

Description:
Information Systems
ESBJERG-BRITANNIAVEJ(DNK)
Denmark
Job Description
Join our affiliate TotalEnergies EP Danmark A/S in Esbjerg!

TotalEnergies Exploration and Production in Denmark (TEPDK) is the subsidiary of TotalEnergies in Denmark, operating major offshore platforms in the North Sea. It is based in Esbjerg, Denmark.

The digital team of TotalEnergies Denmark, including the drilling and wells digital team, supports the broad ambition of digital transformation of exploration and production activities, through applied data science and data-centric exploration of digital transformation use-cases, whose outcome is embedded into productivity and enhanced engineer proofs of concept tools.

For a series of project associated to drilling and well intervention, a position of data scientist is open.

This mission is based in Esbjerg, Denmark, where TotalEnergies Denmark has its operational offices for the Danish North Sea, where the oil and gas platforms are located. The position will focus on exploring or identifying digital use cases (in the domain of drilling and wells performance), and developing high ambition solutions, from exploratory analysis/framing to industrialization by the team or in collaboration with the digital factory.

Your main missions will be:

Job_title: Data Engineer til bekæmpelse af skatteunddragelse
Description:
Vil du være en del af et stærkt fagligt fællesskab? Er du interesseret i at arbejde med komplekse datastrukturer og samfundsvigtige opgaver? Så har vi brug for dig som ny Data Engineer!
Tre tidligere juniorer siger:
”Med forløbet er jeg kommet hurtigt ind i arbejdslivet og er blevet klædt på til at løse opgaver selvstændigt og udvikle effektivt”
” Der har været stort fokus på min udvikling og på at give mig de bedste forudsætninger for at lære. Mine kollegaer har været tålmodige og sikret at arbejdsbyrden ikke har taget overhånd”.
”Under forløbet blev min rolle som Data Engineer hurtigt tegnet tydeligt op for mig. Det var fedt at have så struktureret et forløb, så jeg var sikker på, at jeg fik lært alt det grundlæggende”.
Vi søger flere nyuddannede Data Engineers til vores Data Engineer-forløb, der sætter din læring og kompetenceudvikling i centrum. Du får en unik mulighed for at deltage i et forløb, der er skræddersyet til juniorprofiler, og som giver dig de bedste forudsætninger for at udvikle din faglighed og for at få erfaring i en stor organisation.
DE-forløbet består af oplæg og workshops, som er tilrettelagt, udviklet og afholdt af dine kommende kollegaer i Data Warehouse og Business Intelligence. Forløbet sikrer en effektiv og målrettet onboarding, så du hurtigt får hands-on-erfaring.
Alle teams arbejder agilt inden for SAFe og har et årshjul med fire PI’s. Hvert PI afsluttes med tre dages Hackathon, der giver mere end 140 medarbejdere med forskellige fagligheder mulighed for at samarbejde på tværs om selvvalgte projekter.

Description:

You will be a part of IT Data, Integration & Automation, who creates tools that automate and exhibit data to use for insights and AI. Your focus is to support a Business Unit in their need to be more data driven.
In this job, you will be working with Norlys’ new strategic data platform, where we are building a new foundation. So here, you have the chance to join the development from the start and be part of building the platform. You will be working continuously to enable data product teams to deliver work with substantial autonomy by simplifying the access to services and resources, govern- and maintaining the platform, and with that reduce the cognitive load on the domain teams.

Job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Energy Transition Platform, Hybrid 2+ days on average in our fantastic office! (Full remote available in some cases)
Description:
As an integrated container logistics company, A.P. Moller - Maersk is working to connect and simplify our customers’ supply chains. Every day, we facilitate and impact global trade by offering end-to-end logistics solutions across oceans, ports, air and on land. Our global network enables people in every corner of the world to trade with anyone, anywhere – ultimately creating opportunities for people and communities to thrive, and for businesses to grow.
Why should you work on the Energy Transition Platform?
The world is facing a climate emergency. We see it as our obligation – as an industry leader and with the resources available to us – to do all we can to get to net zero operations as fast as possible and to help our customers decarbonize their global supply chains end to end.
As a key player in an industry responsible for 3.5 billion tons of annual direct emissions, A.P. Moller - Maersk (Maersk) is committed to leading the decarbonization of logistics and taking responsibility to be part of the solution, enabling a green and just transition. In early 2022, we announced the ambitious goal of advancing the target year for our commitment to reach net zero emissions by a full decade, to 2040. This applies to our own operations, but – even more importantly – covers all three emission scopes and supports our customers’ own climate commitments.

Sets the technical direction and establishes the practices for their area, ensuring alignment to the overall architecture for the domain and to established technical strategies across Digital Technology.
Active participation and contribution to cross organizational initiatives and communities are also expected from the lead engineer.

Join our affiliate TotalEnergies EP Danmark A/S in Esbjerg!

TotalEnergies Exploration and Production in Denmark (TEPDK) is the subsidiary of TotalEnergies in Denmark, operating major offshore platforms in the North Sea. It is based in Esbjerg, Denmark.

The digital team of TotalEnergies Denmark, including the drilling and wells digital team, supports the broad ambition of digital transformation of exploration and production activities, through applied data science and data-centric exploration of digital transformation use-cases, whose outcome is embedded into productivity and enhanced engineer proofs of concept tools.

For a series of project associated to drilling and well intervention, a position of data scientist is open.

This mission is based in Esbjerg, Denmark, where TotalEnergies Denmark has its operational offices for the Danish North Sea, where the oil and gas platforms are located. The position will focus on exploring or identifying digital use cases (in the domain of drilling and wells performance), and developing high ambition solutions, from exploratory analysis/framing to industrialization by the team or in collaboration with the digital factory.

Your main missions will be:

Job_title: Electronics Engineer with PCBA test and verification...
Description:
Are you a quality driving engineer who can professionalize test and verification of high-tech electronics? Then keep on reading!
Job description
In 3Shape we are committed to changing dentistry and our world-leading 3D scanners systems for dental clinics and labs are catapulting dentistry to a new digital era for the benefit of our users and their patients.
To help us we need a skillful engineer who can take on responsibility to ensure quality in our custom electronics. That is from best practices in design-for-test methodologies, test automation, developing electronics verification tests for R&D and play an important role in our team developing PCBA production test automation solutions for our production, our diagnostics team and EMS partners. The electronics vary between high-density complex rigid and flex PCBAs with image sensors, FPGA/ARM SoCs, WiFi/BT, intelligent batteries, power converters and sensors. The mix of advanced technologies and miniaturization makes testing a complex challenge which requires both experience and creativity at times.

Description:
Data Engineer Director – Join Our Revolutionary Healthcare Data Insights program at Novo Nordisk

Are you a data engineer who is passionate about making a real impact on the healthcare industry? Do you dream of transforming the way clinical data is handled and shared across the business, with the potential to create value throughout the value chain? If you're excited about enabling real-time access and analysis of clinical data, including RCT, real-world data, multi-omics, images, streaming data, and more, then we have an opportunity you don´t want to miss.


We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer Director to join our team and help us become a global healthcare leader powered by data, analytics, and digital technologies. As a Data Engineer Director, you will play a critical role in building our state-of-the-art data insights platform, FounData, and developing outcomes and solutions that will transform the way we operate. You'll work alongside top talent in the industry and make a significant impact on the way we develop new medicines, improve quality, and create value for Novo Nordisk Development and Novo Nordisk at large.


The FounData program is a new R&D data insights initiative designed to enhance data storage, curation/handling, analysis, and visualizations relevant to the entire organization. This initiative is set to revolutionize the way we use data in decision-making by enabling data availability from a one-stop clinical data shop. To achieve this, we require robust data pipelines and data models across various data modalities. The program is anchored within Data Science in the Development organization in Novo Nordisk (NN), and we aim to create a solution that spans the value chain.

Description:
MAKEEN EnviroTech is at present gearing up with a strong focus on the pioneering Plastcon concept, where the first full scale project is currently approaching the end of the commissioning phase.
The innovative Plastcon technology, through complex multi-technological processes, converts waste plastic into re-usable streams, primarily focused on oil ingredients, that can be refined to various uses. Among these, the re-production of plastics, thus enabling a circular approach to manufacturing, usage and re-usage of plastic products. Read more about the pyrolysis process in Plastcon
The Process Design Team is a key function in the Projects Engineering organization. The team is involved in the core design, of processes, function descriptions and requirement of equipment. Competences spread over the areas of fluid mechanics, chemistry, and thermodynamics.

Job_title: Data engineer med øje for den tværgående arkitektur
Description:
Om stillingen Statens BI sikrer, at beslutninger træffes på et oplyst og korrekt grundlag. Med data som fundament gør vi viden tilgængelig og visualiseret i den kontekst som vores kunder ønsker.

Vi har et klart og tydeligt mål om at skabe gennemsigtighed for den enkelte regnskabsbruger og at understøtte styring og resultatskabelse i de enkelte institutioner. Samtidigt skal vi opfylde Finansministeriets behov for konsolidering af viden og tværgående analyser i forbindelse med udarbejdelse af finansloven.

Det er et spændende, kompliceret og et særdeles aktuelt arbejde, hvor den enkeltes indsats kan måles direkte i de beslutninger, der træffes. BI er et strategisk vigtigt indsatsområde i Finansministeriet, hvilket afspejles i vores arbejde og den gode energi, hvormed vi tilgår vores opgaver.

Statens BI undergår konstant forandring og i takt med den teknologiske udvikling ændres brugernes behov. Derfor er vi gået i gang med at definere den næste generation af Statens BI, så hvis du vil være med til at forme fremtidens forretningsservices og teknologi for Statens BI, er det nu du skal med på rejsen.

Vi søger lige nu en eller flere data engineers, der i samarbejde med vores Product Owners, kan skabe sammenhæng på tværs af løsninger og arkitektur og sikre, at vi følger best practics. Statens BI er bygget på teknologi fra Microsoft.

Om dig Vi ser gerne, at du har følgende færdigheder:


Du vil blandt andet komme til at arbejde med:


Derudover vil du indgå i arbejdet med at definere og implementere den næste generation af Statens BI.

Om os Vi garanterer et meningsfuldt job, hvor faglige udfordringer og personlig udvikling er i fokus fra første dag. Vores BI-team består af 17 gode kollegaer, hvor faglighed og godt humør er i højsædet, for det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde.

BI-teamet indgår i Økonomistyrelsens Center for Systemer, som er et af de største it-udviklingsmiljøer i staten. I Systemcenteret er vi i alt 160 dygtige og ambitiøse it-specialister, der arbejder med it-udvikling, drift, support, infrastruktur, arkitektur og sikkerhed – alt sammen i tæt dialog med og inddragelse af vores kunder.

Hos os betyder tilstedeværelse sammen med vores kollegaer meget, og vi mener, at samarbejde og videndeling på tværs af styrelsen er afgørende for et godt arbejdsmiljø. Samtidig vil vi gerne sikre fleksibilitet for vores medarbejdere, og hjemmearbejde kan løbende aftales mellem chef og medarbejder, når det er foreneligt med opgavevaretagelsen.

Ansættelsesvilkår Du ansættes efter gældende overenskomst med mulighed for forhandling alt efter kvalifikationer.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan sikkerhedsgodkendes til graden hemmeligt og efterfølgende kan opretholde sikkerhedsgodkendelsen i hele din ansættelsesperiode.

Ansættelsesområdet er Finansministeriet med tilhørende institutioner, pt. Finansministeriets departement, Statens Administration, Statens It, Økonomistyrelsen samt Medarbejder- og Kompetencestyrelsen.

Yderligere oplysninger Hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte teamleder Morten Bødtcher på tlf. 20 35 01 79.

Ansøgning Vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning med CV, eksamenspapirer og eventuelle bilag via knappen ”Søg stillingen” senest den 17. april 2023.

Finansministeriet ser mangfoldighed som en styrke og opfordrer alle interesserede kandidater uanset personlig baggrund til at søge. Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning.

Do you have a passion for data and data science? And do you take pride in your data assets and the data-driven decisions and insights they generate? Then come join our team of Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the SuperAI Centre of Excellence in Danske Bank!
For 150 years, Danske Bank has strived to be a driver of growth and development in society. In this time, the bank has amassed experience and huge volumes of data that has and can be connected to open a treasure trove of information with societal impact.
As a team, we assist in uncovering and preventing money laundering and other financial crimes, provide credit risk metrics that ensure Danske Bank has a real-time data-driven understanding of the risks it takes on and, conduct academic research to further data efforts within the financial sector.

Description:
Description

Are you data-driven, and have a genuine interest in business analytics? Do you want to take the next step and work with a competent team to further develop your analytical and engineering skills? You might be the one for this job! We are looking for a new Business Data Engineer who wishes to join our team at the Copenhagen office.

As a Business Data Engineer at Gaming Innovation Group, you will be in charge of the data transformation and data pipeline tasks by delivering solutions and reports to each relevant vertical and department across the company. You will build scripts, clean and prepare datasets for the main stakeholders in the Business Intelligence unit. This role will let you collaborate with business partners and skillful team members so as to execute technical solutions that would be performant, scalable with best in class user experience.

We hope that you want to join our wonderful Business Analytics team

The best part about the workplace

Our international culture and office set up will make you not want to leave. A large open office with a gym, a cinema, a bar and much more! Office vibes are a big part of our culture and have been built to help motivate and inspire. We also offer a full range of support and mentoring to make sure you have the tools you need to succeed. If that is not enough, you will also have access to a full suite of internal and external resources to help power your knowledge and skill set!


Provide insights and interpret reports to a broad audience

Develop data models transformations and scripts to improve our automation pipelines

Translate business requirements into technical specifications

Provide comprehensive solutions using a variety of programming languages and data tools (e.g., querying data with SQL, build DBT transformations)

Build and test data models in order to make forecasts and predictions

Develop scalable solutions give from business stakeholders

Maintain and organize datasets and transformations among the different data sources

Collaborate with top management with ad hoc reporting/tasks requirements


For this full time-position, we are looking for a candidate who

Business work experience in data pipelines and automation

Previous experience with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
Experience with data transformation tools. Experience with DBT will be an advantage

Experience with Python or other programming languages

Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization
General understanding of data orchestration and ETL. Airflow and Airbyte will be an advantage

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Be able to handle multiple tasks across different areas of the company

As we are inspired by diversity and willingness to learn, please feel free to apply even though you do not tick off all the boxes or have a different background you deem relevant. This is a perfect opportunity for anyone seeking to challenge themselves and want to develop both as a person and as a team. In GIG we work together!

Who we are

Gaming Innovation Group is an industry-leading iGaming and sports betting provider, working in one of the most competitive branches of online marketing. GiG is a multinational company with a vibrant company culture where GiGsters play hard but work even harder. On the Media (Marketing) side of the business, we are +150 employees, and we work with IT-driven marketing and offer marketing services to some of the biggest operators in the online sports betting and iGaming industry.

You will be in our office in Copenhagen in Nørrebro, where we have +60 Employees from around 20 different countries. We have a nice naturally lit open office space and here you will find a good mix of designers, writers, Marketing and IT people. Freedom with responsibility is a key term for us and we hope that you would join the fun and help the company grow to new heights.

Join us!

You can read more about us here.

https://www.gigmedia.com

Job Description
Core Responsibilities:
Enabling & Technology (ET) is a part of the Mould Engineering organisation. ET provides strong Standards & Guidelines, IT Tools, Problem Solving & Quality Improvements, Business Support & Development of NX and Team Center across Mould Engineering and other stakeholders. The ET team consists of nine dedicated specialist with a diverse set of backgrounds.
Mould Engineering has a massive focus on utilizing the possibilities within digitalization to support the overall digital strategy within The LEGO Group. This role supports this digitalization journey. Digitalization will challenge our current processes and ways of working to improve our ability to deliver high quality moulds for current and future industrialization. Digitalization will also enable lead time and cost reductions for the entire engineering value chain!

Description:
Make your ability count at NNE
We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you want to work on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.
Work with us
Novo Nordisk is investing 18 BN DKK in establishing four new manufacturing facilities and expanding three existing facilities at their manufacturing site in Kalundborg. NNE is the engineering partner on several of these major projects and plays an essential role in establishing the new facilities. These will include state-of-the-art production technologies bridged with Novo Nordisk’s more than 50 years of experience in biomanufacturing. This is your chance to join NNE and help us build the Novo Nordisk factories of the future.

We are looking for a curious and engaged colleague to work in our expanding Manufacturing Intelligence (MI) department. We work closely together with Data Scientists, Process- and Automation-Engineers. We will help you grow and learn much more than just data engineering. Together we build best-in-class data engineering solutions, validation of the solutions and contribute to laying the foundation for data-driven decision-making for our pharma customers.

Description:
Aqua feed process technology - Innovation Scientist / Engineer
Execution of development, research, and operational projects within process technology
Do you have an interest in innovative process technology projects where you are part of developing the next generation of fish feed, looking into functional feed/food ingredients and technologies AND manage operational support projects in close collaboration with our factories.
We are looking to hire a new colleague into our Process Innovation Team which is located together with our process innovation laboratory and state-of-the-art pilot plant facilities in Denmark.
The position will focus on applied ingredient science, process technology knowledge and process engineering in relation to operational factory projects. In this position you will join a skilled international team, that can support your continuous training and journey in aqua feed technology, in a company where innovation and sustainability are at the heart of everything we do.

Job_title: Data Engineers til bekæmpelse af international skatteunddragelse
Description:
Vil du være en del af et stærkt fagligt fællesskab? Er du interesseret i at arbejde med komplekse datastrukturer og samfundsvigtige opgaver? Så har vi brug for dig som ny Data Engineer!
Vi søger flere Data Engineers til vores udviklingsteams, hvis hovedopgave er at hente data fra EU og USA til kontrol, der skal modvirke international skatteunddragelse. Vi har netop hjemtaget nye projekter og har brug for flere kræfter til at løse opgaven.
Alle teams arbejder agilt inden for SAFe og har et årshjul med fire PI’s. Hvert PI afsluttes med tre dages Hackathon, der giver mere end 140 medarbejdere med forskellige fagligheder mulighed for at samarbejde på tværs om selvvalgte projekter.
Stærkt fagfællesskab og kollegialt sammenhold

Job_title: Senior Engineer - Shape the Future of Fintech
Description:
Monthio, a leading software development company, is revolutionizing the financial services industry with our groundbreaking B2B SaaS platform. Founded in 2018, we empower financial institutions to optimize their decision-making process for providing loans through state-of-the-art technology, unparalleled data analysis, and advanced transaction classification. Our passionate 44-member team is committed to delivering financial institutions a comprehensive and user-friendly understanding of their customers' financial situations.

The Role
We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior Engineer to join our dynamic team in Copenhagen, playing a pivotal role in transforming the financial services industry. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the development of one of Denmark's most exciting fintech products. As we continue to expand, you will contribute to refining our product, proactively addressing and minimizing technical debt. You will collaborate with the team to create, maintain, and operate our exceptional products while actively participating in personal and team growth.

Description:
Make your ability count at NNE
We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you want to work on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.
Work with us
Do you work with cloud services, have you used CDK and are familiar with CI/CD pipelines? Is programming like second nature to you? Does building real-time data connectivity pipelines supporting advanced analytics pique your interest? Would you like to improve your skills in building cloud-based applications in AWS or Azure/Databricks? Then join our Manufacturing Intelligence team in Copenhagen and become our next Consultant within Cloud- and Data Engineering!

NNE Manufacturing Intelligence is a full-service provider of intelligence solutions within pharma manufacturing. We work with all aspects of data engineering/data science from cloud services, consultancy services, design, implementation, test/validation, and data analytics, machine learning to AI. Our specialty is data connectivity solutions for Pharma manufacturing, that enable data-driven decision-making, automation of processes and faster access to critical production data.



We are looking for an experienced data engineer or recent graduate with relevant work experience, who is outgoing, curious and engaged, and holds high ambitions for ensuring great quality in own work, and a willingness to share and learn from your peers. You will be asked to contribute, from day one, to our growing team of diverse Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

Your role as a Consultant in Manufacturing Intelligence will be to develop, test and implement the next generation of cloud solutions for pharma manufacturing environments. Collaborate with customers to turn ideas into value adding solutions and supporting them in every step of the way from design to implementation; and lastly, you will be a part of the project teams and participate on equal terms with your 50+ committed colleagues in Denmark and India.

We offer colleagues with pharma domain knowledge that can further advance your cloud skills within this field, along with hundreds of years of experience in pharma engineering.

Job_title: Cloud Engineer for our Computer Vision and MLOps area
Description:
Cloud Engineer for our Computer Vision and MLOps area
Do you want to contribute to the automation of highly manual construction tasks, as part of a Computer Vision and MLOps area in a SaaS house where the focus is on a great product?
Your new role
The area of computer vision and machine learning is ever growing at Dalux. The area is pioneered by our two Reality teams, with the goal of automating many of the highly manually tasks found in the construction industry. To accomplish this, we utilize Computer Vision and Machine Learning to capture and analyze images from the construction site. As you can imagine, these are large amounts of data, and the processing of these data requires a solid cloud infrastructure – that’s where you come in!

Description:
Teton is building technology that lets us all re-imagine the role of the healthcare worker.
The worldwide nursing shortage is currently crippling hospitals and care homes, and the new technologies will play a crucial role in saving the healthcare system from collapse. At Teton we operate differently than the traditional companies within the field, by having a relentless focus on the product and users and developing solutions in lightning speed. In 2 years, Teton has developed and commercialized a full fleshed AI product, used by health care worker everyday and covering more than 140 patient-rooms to date.

The job:
We are looking for a string engineer that is very organised, responsible, and creative, your code will be deployed to our fleet, being able to create solutions and also thoroughly validating them is key to this role.

Accenture Industry X is on a mission to help our clients transform their products, operations, and business models to the new green future and to deliver human friendly and sustainable business outcomes. We will assist our clients to achieve increased productivity and reduced climate footprint by applying new technologies and embedding connectivity and intelligence into their operational and managing processes.
Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XaLxTEI3atI
We now want to strengthen our team with you that thrive working in a dynamic environment and are motivated by driving digital implementation and transformation projects accelerated by technology.
Are you passionate about sustainability powered by technology and innovative solutions? Do you like working with people and supporting them on their journey? Are you triggered by helping clients transitioning to the new circular economy? Do you want to work with implementation of IoT and analytics solutions, digital twins/threads, digital worker, machine learning and AI? If that is the case, Accenture Industry X is the place for you.

Description:
Who we are
At EIVEE, we’re on a mission to make a sustainable world possible and profitable. To achieve this, we target carbon emissions as well as costs, knowing that Procurement plays a foundational role in driving sustainability impacts and compliance. Because without transparency into what you buy and from where, how would you know how much that product or service emits?
We offer a state-of-the-art product that provides businesses with a high-quality and validated overview of their climate footprint and cost transparency with automated expert insights, and we do this through an innovative and ground-breaking SaaS-like business development platform. With our recently announced seed round of 4M€ and so many businesses that may benefit from our help, our market size is almost unlimited, and our growth potential enormous – which is why we need you.

Job_title: Koordinator til fremtidens BI Analytics platform i Forsvaret
Description:
Vil du være et bærende element i en tid hvor cyber, digitalisering og data betyder mere dag for dag? Vi har brug for en engageret koordinator til den fremtidige udvikling af BI & Analytics, som skal være med til at opbygge Forsvarets data.

Business Intelligence og analytics området i Forsvarsministeriets koncern er klar til at tage det næste skridt på sin rejse mod at understøtte koncernen i at blive mere datadrevet.
Om os
Koncern IT er ansvarlig for at drive, vedligeholde og udvikle Forsvarets IT og i det hele taget digitalisere Forsvarsministeriets koncern. Organisationen tæller omkring 700 medarbejdere (ca. 1/3 militære og 2/3 civile) og er dermed blandt de største i den offentlige sektor.

I BI organisationen arbejder vi som et hold og deler både viden og ansvar, og vi har et godt arbejdsmiljø præget af humor, begejstring og gensidig respekt. Vi støtter hinanden i både opgaveløsningen, beslutningsfaserne og vidensdelingen. Du vil stå skulder mod skulder med erfarne og skarpe kolleger, som elsker at dele ud af deres viden og blive udfordret af nye ideer.

Description:
Data is the most valuable resource in modern food production
Digitalization has reached a turning point: in a growing global market where safe food of high quality is in demand, digital solutions indisputably add value to the production chain. And we now have the knowledge and offerings to win core business with digital services as a key enabler.
Used the right way, data can secure high uptime and reliable performance. Through cloud-connected instruments and SmartAnalytics, we obtain intelligent data. This leads to better product quality, fair payment, production efficiency and reduced waste. It is simply the way that half a century of technological know-how within food analysis and digital innovation go together.
High uptime and reliable performance are top of mind in any production environment and it can be safeguarded through remote monitoring and assistance, automation and sharing of knowledge. All in all, a more intelligent use of nature’s agricultural resources. That is good news for the future!
