Join our affiliate TotalEnergies EP Danmark A/S in Esbjerg!

TotalEnergies Exploration and Production Denmark (TEPDK) is the subsidiary of TotalEnergies in Denmark, operating major offshore platforms in the north sea. It is based in Esbjerg, Denmark.

The digital teams of TEPDK have built a track record of advanced data exploration, concept-proofing, and development of functional prototypes of ambitious digital solutions.

For a series of projects associated to drilling and well intervention, a position of full stack Engineer is open. This mission is based in Esbjerg, Denmark, where TotalEnergies Denmark has its operational offices for the Danish North sea, where the oil and gas platforms are located.

Sommerassistance medhjælper

Department: Operations Date: Mar 31, 2023

Sommerassistance medhjælpere til FMC, Rønland

Vi søger motiverede og engagerede sommerassistance medhjælpere i forbindelse med at vores fabrik skal gennemgå det årlige gennemgribende sommervedligehold i perioden fra ca. 10. eller 17. juli til 6. august 2023 (perioden kan variere fra område til område).

Sikkerhed er en grundlæggende værdi for os, og du vil få en vigtig rolle i at være med til at sikre at vores sommervedligehold udføres sikkert og i henhold til FMC´s sikkerhedskrav.

Du får dermed medansvar for at vore vedligeholdelsesopgaver udføres sikkert.

Du vil efter anvisning af en Shift Supervisor, Værkstedsleder eller Lageransvarlig få følgende opgaver:

Vi søger ansvarlige og opsøgende medhjælpere:

Vi forestiller os, at du eksempelvis læser til ingeniør, maskinmester eller har en håndværksmæssig baggrund, og at du er motiveret for at bruge din sommerferie på at få noget praktisk og kompetencegivende erfaring. Du har desuden taget førstehjælpskursus.

Du har "drive" og det er naturligt for dig at tage ansvar og være opsøgende i forhold til opgaver og samarbejde med andre, ligesom det er at skulle følge standarder og regler. Du kan bedst lide at tingene er i orden og sætter en ære i, at det du laver, bliver gjort ordentlig. Det er ligeledes vigtigt, at du er fleksibel både mht. opgaver og arbejdstider.



FMC vil naturligvis sikre, at du bliver grundigt trænet i vores sikkerhedsmæssige standarder og at du bliver instrueret i dine opgaver som entrings- og brandvagt. Vi vil arrange halvdagskursus i elementær brandbekæmpelse og det at være brandvagt før du starter.



Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Manager, Henriette Knudsen på mobil: 20303249.

Vi glæder os til at modtage din ansøgning senest den 15. maj 2023 - og kalder ind til samtaler løbende.

Description:
Søg stillingen her
Vil du være med til at optimere udnyttelsen af Topsøe’ produktionsudstyr og reducere deres vedligeholdelsesomkostninger?
Vil du med på transformationsrejsen fra havari mod planlagt vedligehold?
Så er du måske Topsøe’ nye Reliability Engineer.
Katalysatorfabrikken i Frederikssund spiller en væsentlig rolle i virksomheden som flagskibs produktions-anlæg. Fabrikken blev grundlagt i 1963 og er siden blevet udvidet og har nu ca. 560 medarbejdere på otte produktionsanlæg, lagerlokaler, værksteder, laboratorier og supportfunktioner. Det årlige produktionsvolumen er ca. 32.000 tons katalysator til globale markeder. Fabrikken er effektiv og er løbende forbedret over årene gennem optimering og forbedringer af Topsøe’ produktionslinjer.

Job_title: Praktik inden for Kvalitet og Bæredygtighed
Description:
Location: Danmark, Guderup
Praktik inden for Kvalitet og Bæredygtighed

LINAK søger studerende til praktik inden for kvalitet! Vi søger dig, som har gå-på-mod, lysten til at lære og som gerne vil være del af et dynamisk og engageret team.

Inden for kvalitet arbejder vi med Bæredygtighed, Q-test, produktionskvalitet og leverandørkvalitet. Områder som hver især sikrer, at vi leverer de bedste produkter til vores kunder. Du kan være med i processen, om det drejer sig om arbejde med tiltag som skal sikre LINAKs bæredygtige udvikling, teste nye software løsninger, eller sikre mekaniske test af produktemner og optimere kvalitetsprocesser henvendt mod leverandører.

Du vil blive inddraget eller være ansvarlig for værdiskabende projekter, reelle problemstillinger, og du vil arbejde med både større og mindre opgaver.

Job_title: Stamdatamedarbejder til Stam- og geodatasektionen i Forsvarsministeriets Ejendomsstyrelse
Description:
#Forsvaret.dk #Værdatkæmpefor
Lyder det spændende at komme til at arbejde for en af landets største ejendomsbesiddere med mere end 6500 bygninger?
Vil du være med til at sikre, at vi får retvisende og opdateret dokumentation for vores bygninger?
Kunne du tænke dig en ansvarsfuld og udfordrende rolle?
Hos Forsvarsministeriets Ejendomsstyrelse søger vi en dygtig stamdatamedarbejder til vores Digitaliseringssektion.
Om os
Forsvarsministeriet Ejendomsstyrelse er kort fortalt Forsvarsministeriets ejendomsselskab. Vi skaber, udvikler og drifter faciliteter for hele Forsvaret.
Vi er en stor landsdækkende arbejdsplads, som i 2022 hjemtager en masse opgaver, og derfor bliver mange flere medarbejdere.

Vi tilbyder en spændende arbejdsplads i et uformelt miljø, hvor der er god mulighed for faglig sparring og kompetenceudvikling, og hvor du i høj grad har mulighed for at påvirke aktiviteternes gang og ikke mindst din hverdag.

Du kommer til at arbejde i vores Digitaliseringssektion, hvor vi arbejder med bygningsstamdata (Revit og AutoCAD), geospatiale data og GIS.

Vi skal sikre, at data er tilstrækkelige, tilgængelige og valide, så resten af organisationen kan træffe data drevne beslutninger på et opdateret og retvisende grundlag.

Vores sektion består af medarbejdere med mange forskellige uddannelser. Det spænder over landinspektører, byggetekniker, tekniske assistenter, Kort- og Landmålingstekniker og biologer.

Vi har en god og uformel omgangstone i afdelingen, og der er stor grad af frihed i opgaveløsningen. Derudover tilbyder vi en spændende arbejdsplads med mulighed for faglig sparring og kompetenceudvikling.

Description:
Do you want to contribute to development related to high-quality voice- and data communication for aircraft passengers and crew? As Embedded Software Engineer at Cobham Aerospace Communications, you will be part of an agile aero software engineering team consisting of 30 colleagues in Lyngby.
Your main tasks will be software design, verifying software requirements, software implementation, software validation and verification for functional and non-functional requirements.

Working as Embedded Software Engineer means:
Developing advanced satcom systems for aircrafts

Job_title: Handlekraftig ingeniør med godt overblik og solidt GMP fundament
Description:
Job Description:
Har du lyst til at arbejde i en spændende virksomhed fyldt med ildsjæle og gode kollegaer, som sammen med dig er fundamentet i en virksomhed, der sætter en ære i at sikre fremtidens API?
Velkommen til din nye arbejdsplads
Er du en erfaren, målrettet ”hands-on” ingeniør eller lignende med et solidt fundament i EHS og GMP? Hvis ja, så er denne stilling som ingeniør til Teknik- & Miljø afdelingen til vores Mezalasin API virksomhed i Hvidovre, måske det næste skridt i din karriere. Syntese A/S er inde i en spændende udvikling med konstant optimering og udvidelse af eksisterende produktion. Vi har mange års erfaring med fremstilling af Active Pharmaceutical Ingrediens (API), som produceres i henhold til GMP og sælges til den farmaceutiske industri.
Din kommende hverdag
Dit primære arbejdsområde er gennemførelse af ændrings-, afvigelses- og CAPA-sager, sideløbende med disse aktiviteter kommer kvalificering af produktionsudstyr, Utility og faciliteter. Du bidrager aktivt med en positiv attitude og med en ”can do” indstilling drevet af ønsket om holdbare løsninger i tråd med cGMP og EHS. Dit arbejde er til de højeste standarder og opfylder ambitiøse mål.

Denmark API Production (Syntese)

Job_title: Senior embedded software developer – leading subsea technology
Description:
Company Profile:
Teledyne Marine is a world leader in supplying high-quality underwater acoustic solutions, underwater autonomous vehicles, navigation systems and software with global presence and service facilities around the world. In the European part of Teledyne Marine, we are specialized in design, development, manufacturing, marketing and commissioning of advanced Multibeam sonar systems, Inertial Navigation Systems with Fiber Optic Gyro’s and software to manage sensors and systems and perform data processing. We operate in the hydrographic, offshore, dredging, defense & security and marine research business areas.
Job Purpose
The team support all sensor product lines from a shared software framework, delivering multiple embedded software systems based on same platform. The teamwork with logic/math execution in highly efficient C/C++ code, and mostly use Linux to run the embedded software.

Software Engineer at leading AI scale-up
We are looking for a skilled Software engineer, who will be part of our core team developing world-class AI solutions for customer service and support including chat/email/voicebots, live chat, AI assistance for ticket handling, and much more.
You will be joining a fast-growing start-up and an excellent team of experienced engineers and data scientists to create innovative software used by millions of users across the globe.
As a software engineer at SupWiz, you will be working on building new features for our core products, integrating our solution with platforms like ServiceNow and Zendesk, and developing key tools and functionalities for our internal innovation projects. You will also work closely together with our service delivery teams, to deliver an excellent experience for our customers and millions of end-users.

Job_title: UI/UX Intern at Valtech Aarhus - Fall 2023
Description:
Do you have to do an internship throughout your studies, and is it planned for fall 2023? And do you want a fast-paced internship where you get to work with some of the biggest brands in an international context? Then look no further.
Learn how to make great mistakes; come be our intern at Valtech's offices in Aarhus!

THE OPPORTUNITY
At Valtech, we are looking for awesome, curious, fearless, friendly interns for the UX and Design team. You will get to work with all aspects of your field of expertise, from workshops to pixel-perfecting, and you will never work alone.
At Valtech, we focus on matching the right people with the right task. That way, we do our best work, AND we have fun while doing it. And don’t worry if you are not quite sure what your “best work” is. We will help you figure this out.

Would you like to help us revolutionise the development and manufacturing of electronic, photonics, and optics industries? Welcome to ATLANT 3D – we invite you for an amazing journey where you will be a part of a team working towards disrupting 60 years of micro and nanofabrication technologies and systems. We offer you a once-in-a-lifetime experience. What we develop is unique, and we are incredibly excited to make a difference.
We are looking for a Machine Software Developer Engineer to build and deliver machine software control solutions for ATLANT 3D’s line of products ranging from implementing the software system architecture inclusive of real time controls, and data management. The software architecture should meet customer security and IP protection, interface to manufacturing factory standards as used in semiconductor manufacturing, and implementation of of-the-shelve solutions.

Are you a Software Engineer (a.k.a. Java Developer) seeking new challenges? Do you have the ambition to be part of a team of highly skilled Engineers? Then you might be the one we are looking for to join our Product Development department in Copenhagen!
Key about your role
In your role as a Java Developer/Software Engineer, you will be part of a multidisciplinary team of Business Analysts, Testers and Software Engineers, responsible for the development of everything from bug fixes to the implementation of new features. You won’t be alone, and can count on support from enthusiastic colleagues who are always happy to discuss solutions. However, as our application is complex, you will be expected to carry out proactive self-driven investigations. We strongly believe that the best argument should always win, independent of job title or seniority, and as such we look for engineers that will actively drive design discussions and in code reviews (we use Bitbucket intensively for such functions). This approach is also true for our processes: if you think we can optimise a process or a way of working, we strongly encourage you to share ideas with your team. In general, we try to be pragmatic: we use SCRUM but are not fanatical about it. Things must make sense. If not, we change it. We plan our tasks in two-week sprints, but we are agile and can reprioritise as and when required. Other key characteristics of your role include: you love driving initiatives, you are a team player, you are thorough; you have high ambitions for yourself, the code and our product. Pension knowledge and/or mathematical flair is an advantage but not a requirement.

Description:
Let’s reimagine how the world moves.
As an international business on a high-tech journey, we don’t just transport millions of tons of cargo. We’re leading a digital revolution in global trade, creating opportunities for millions of customers around the world through new technology, data science, and artificial intelligence.
Growing your skills with Maersk means growing global trade and reinventing our industry, creating a digital foundation that moves the world. But it also means creating life-enhancing prosperity for people and communities through exciting initiatives.
Where will your technology career move next?
We are hiring for a SAP Automation Engineer with a strong knowledge and configuration experience on core SAP Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) processes and tools. You will use your multiple lifecycle implementation experience using various ALM tools - SAP Solution Manager, SAP Focused Build, SAP Focused Insights, SAP Focused Run and Cloud ALM.

For a series of projects associated to drilling and well intervention, a position of full stack Engineer is open. This mission is based in Esbjerg, Denmark, where TotalEnergies Denmark has its operational offices for the Danish North sea, where the oil and gas platforms are located.

Job_title: Test Engineer Expert for non-functional tests - onsite
Description:
About WSA
WS Audiology combines over 140 years of experience in pioneering better solutions to help people with hearing loss. With a passion for impact, our around 12.000 employees are committed to achieving our purpose: wonderful sound for all. With brands like Signia, Widex, Audio Service, Rexton and Vibe, and with diverse assets across wholesale, retail, online, managed care and diagnostic solutions, we are active in over 125 markets. Going beyond together, we achieve annual revenues of around EUR 2 billion.

The Team
The team consist of highly skilled, dedicated, and experienced Software Test experts – collaborating with our Test Automation Architects, Test automation Engineers, System Integration, Software- and Security-Architects etc.

Job_title: Embedded Software Engineer - Aircraft satcom systems for safety and entertainment
Description:
Do you want to contribute to development related to high-quality voice- and data communication for aircraft passengers and crew? Do you have experience in C and C++ programming and data communication protocols? Then this is a unique opportunity for you to become a part of an agiel software engineering team in Lyngby, Denmark.
As Embedded Software Engineer at Cobham Aerospace Communications, you will be part of an agile aero software engineering team consisting of 30 colleagues in Lyngby.
Your main tasks will be software design, verifying software requirements, software implementation, software validation and verification for functional and non-functional requirements.

Working as Embedded Software Engineer means:
Developing advanced satcom systems for aircrafts

Sommerassistance medhjælper

Department: Operations Date: Mar 31, 2023

Sommerassistance medhjælpere til FMC, Rønland

Vi søger motiverede og engagerede sommerassistance medhjælpere i forbindelse med at vores fabrik skal gennemgå det årlige gennemgribende sommervedligehold i perioden fra ca. 10. eller 17. juli til 6. august 2023 (perioden kan variere fra område til område).

Sikkerhed er en grundlæggende værdi for os, og du vil få en vigtig rolle i at være med til at sikre at vores sommervedligehold udføres sikkert og i henhold til FMC´s sikkerhedskrav.

Du får dermed medansvar for at vore vedligeholdelsesopgaver udføres sikkert.

Du vil efter anvisning af en Shift Supervisor, Værkstedsleder eller Lageransvarlig få følgende opgaver:

Vi søger ansvarlige og opsøgende medhjælpere:

Vi forestiller os, at du eksempelvis læser til ingeniør, maskinmester eller har en håndværksmæssig baggrund, og at du er motiveret for at bruge din sommerferie på at få noget praktisk og kompetencegivende erfaring. Du har desuden taget førstehjælpskursus.

Du har "drive" og det er naturligt for dig at tage ansvar og være opsøgende i forhold til opgaver og samarbejde med andre, ligesom det er at skulle følge standarder og regler. Du kan bedst lide at tingene er i orden og sætter en ære i, at det du laver, bliver gjort ordentlig. Det er ligeledes vigtigt, at du er fleksibel både mht. opgaver og arbejdstider.



FMC vil naturligvis sikre, at du bliver grundigt trænet i vores sikkerhedsmæssige standarder og at du bliver instrueret i dine opgaver som entrings- og brandvagt. Vi vil arrange halvdagskursus i elementær brandbekæmpelse og det at være brandvagt før du starter.



Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Manager, Henriette Knudsen på mobil: 20303249.

Vi glæder os til at modtage din ansøgning senest den 15. maj 2023 - og kalder ind til samtaler løbende.

Job_title: Handlekraftig ingeniør med godt overblik og solidt GMP fundament
Description:
Job Description:
Har du lyst til at arbejde i en spændende virksomhed fyldt med ildsjæle og gode kollegaer, som sammen med dig er fundamentet i en virksomhed, der sætter en ære i at sikre fremtidens API?
Velkommen til din nye arbejdsplads
Er du en erfaren, målrettet ”hands-on” ingeniør eller lignende med et solidt fundament i EHS og GMP? Hvis ja, så er denne stilling som ingeniør til Teknik- & Miljø afdelingen til vores Mezalasin API virksomhed i Hvidovre, måske det næste skridt i din karriere. Syntese A/S er inde i en spændende udvikling med konstant optimering og udvidelse af eksisterende produktion. Vi har mange års erfaring med fremstilling af Active Pharmaceutical Ingrediens (API), som produceres i henhold til GMP og sælges til den farmaceutiske industri.
Din kommende hverdag
Dit primære arbejdsområde er gennemførelse af ændrings-, afvigelses- og CAPA-sager, sideløbende med disse aktiviteter kommer kvalificering af produktionsudstyr, Utility og faciliteter. Du bidrager aktivt med en positiv attitude og med en ”can do” indstilling drevet af ønsket om holdbare løsninger i tråd med cGMP og EHS. Dit arbejde er til de højeste standarder og opfylder ambitiøse mål.

Denmark API Production (Syntese)

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Job_title: Stamdatamedarbejder til Stam- og geodatasektionen i Forsvarsministeriets Ejendomsstyrelse
Description:
#Forsvaret.dk #Værdatkæmpefor
Lyder det spændende at komme til at arbejde for en af landets største ejendomsbesiddere med mere end 6500 bygninger?
Vil du være med til at sikre, at vi får retvisende og opdateret dokumentation for vores bygninger?
Kunne du tænke dig en ansvarsfuld og udfordrende rolle?
Hos Forsvarsministeriets Ejendomsstyrelse søger vi en dygtig stamdatamedarbejder til vores Digitaliseringssektion.
Om os
Forsvarsministeriet Ejendomsstyrelse er kort fortalt Forsvarsministeriets ejendomsselskab. Vi skaber, udvikler og drifter faciliteter for hele Forsvaret.
Vi er en stor landsdækkende arbejdsplads, som i 2022 hjemtager en masse opgaver, og derfor bliver mange flere medarbejdere.

Vi tilbyder en spændende arbejdsplads i et uformelt miljø, hvor der er god mulighed for faglig sparring og kompetenceudvikling, og hvor du i høj grad har mulighed for at påvirke aktiviteternes gang og ikke mindst din hverdag.

Du kommer til at arbejde i vores Digitaliseringssektion, hvor vi arbejder med bygningsstamdata (Revit og AutoCAD), geospatiale data og GIS.

Vi skal sikre, at data er tilstrækkelige, tilgængelige og valide, så resten af organisationen kan træffe data drevne beslutninger på et opdateret og retvisende grundlag.

Vores sektion består af medarbejdere med mange forskellige uddannelser. Det spænder over landinspektører, byggetekniker, tekniske assistenter, Kort- og Landmålingstekniker og biologer.

Vi har en god og uformel omgangstone i afdelingen, og der er stor grad af frihed i opgaveløsningen. Derudover tilbyder vi en spændende arbejdsplads med mulighed for faglig sparring og kompetenceudvikling.

Udvikler til Industri-Automation

højteknologiske, avancerede løsninger til produktionsoptimering, så tag et kig på nedenstående.

It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.
Release Train Engineer
Job ID: R-31162
Location: Brande or Skovlunde
Organization: Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy in Denmark
Mode of employment: Full Time
For our System Integration (SI) Department within the SW Division, we are looking for a skilled Release Train Engineer (RTE) to join our growing, dedicated and, global team. In the SW division we deliver quality SW to both new power plants but also to the existing fleet with tens of thousands of turbines.
In the System Integration team, we fulfill the role of a Solution level System Team in SAFe. Which means that we are responsible for; the SW test strategy, the enforcement of it, and the creation and maintenance of build- and test environments in which automated tests are executed. This involves both HIL setups and small to large virtual environments, thus handling both the hard real-time and large scalability requirements. Our CI/CD tools and services are hosted both in our own infrastructure and in the cloud. We operate 1 data center and 2 test labs.

Description:
Want to help Lyngsoe Systems to create mission critical software and products that help customers throughout the globe?
Then join our dedicated and experienced team of developers and architects and be a part of creating solutions that can optimize supply chain flow, create real-time visibility in postal sorting offices, reduce emissions by optimizing transport planning, as well as increase patient care within hospitals using state-of-the-art tracking technologies like RFID and BLE.
Job description
Lyngsoe Systems is currently on a journey of growth and development. We are looking for Software Developers to join our platform and solutions team.

Der er fuld fart på den grønne omstilling, og Energinet spiller en helt central rolle, da vi har ansvaret for at indpasse vedvarende energi i elnettet og etablere tilslutning af nye havvind-projekter, som fx Energiøer og ”Danmark kan mere II”. Du kan være med til at gøre en forskel, da vi lige nu søger en ny kollega til at varetage Geoscience opgaver. Du får et selvstændigt ansvar med en bred kontaktflade både i og udenfor organisationen.
Du bliver en del af en organisation, hvor fleksibilitet og arbejdsliv i balance står højt på dagsordenen, og hvor din faglige og personlige udvikling vægtes højt. Du får tilbudt udstyr til en god hjemmearbejdsplads for at kunne få det bedste ud af, at være på kontoret i Fredericia eller arbejde hjemmefra.
Geoscience arbejder både med onshore og offshore projekter
Du bliver en del af afdelingen Miljø og Geoscience i vores selskab Eltransmission. Vi har ansvaret for alle geofysiske og geotekniske undersøgelser for vores onshore og offshore projekter, samt ansvaret for miljøvurderinger og myndighedstilladelser. Du kommer til at indgå i et stærkt fagligt team med fokus på vidensdeling i et projekt- og udviklingsorienteret miljø.

Job_title: Key Account for cloud connected stationary battery solutions
Description:
Key Account for cloud connected battery solutions
Do you have a proven track record in selling stationary electrical products and solutions?
Do you have demonstrated ability to apply in-depth knowledge to respond to customer demands resulting in long term contracts, then you may be our new Sales Consultant for industrial batteries.
Based in Denmark, XOLTA develop and manufacture advanced cloud connected stationary battery solutions and industrial battery packs for various mobile end market applications. We are on a growth journey, driven by high ambitions and a passion for green energy and we need you onboard.
You will join an experienced international team dedicated to the green transition through developing impactful lasting products to propel the advance of renewable energy. On top of the physical energy storage products and battery packs, the XOLTA offering consists of a cloud-based platform for energy optimization, reseller support functions and end user interface to the products.

Er du en dygtig softwaredesigner som finder det interessant at være med fra ide til færdigt produkt?
Har du lyst til at arbejde i en innovativ virksomhed, som byder på spændende udfordringer og stor kreativ frihed?
Hvis svaret er ja, så kunne TP Radio måske være det rette sted for dig…
Vi søger en person
som er uddannet ingeniør eller lignende
som har interesse for og stor viden om embedded software. Vi arbejder primært i Amtel Studio og der programmeres i C, men også C++ og Assembler
som kan skrive PC-programmer til opsætning og interface til HW

Technical Supporter/Teknisk Support
Men først, hvem er Dalux?
Dalux er en innovativ ConTech-virksomhed dedikeret til at skubbe grænserne for hvordan teknologi kan sikre en smartere og mere effektiv byggebranche. Vi tilbyder i dag vores brugevenlige digitale værktøjer og BIM-teknologi (3D informationsmodeller) til entreprenører, bygherrer og rådgivere i mere end 140 lande. Men vi er samtidig i gang med en høj vækst og har netop åbnet vores 25. kontor og har nu medarbejdere i 18 forskellige lande. Det er derfor et rigtig spændende tidspunkt at komme med på rejsen og direkte få indflydelse på vores videre udvikling her i Dalux!
Fantastisk! Men hvad bliver min rolle?

Description:
For KILDE A/S Automation i Skive søges en erfaren Technical Lead, Automation
Kan du se dig selv i en helt central Technical Team Lead position indenfor Automationsløsninger på højt avanceret maskin- og procesteknologi til førende industrikunder i ind- og udland, så giver dette job dig en enestående mulighed for faglig og personlig udvikling.
KILDE A/S Automation er en visionær og fremtidsorienteret virksomhed, og er kendetegnet ved et internationalt format med ’best practice’ i fokus.
Der beskæftiges ca. 100 medarbejdere, heraf omkring 50 i produktionen. Medarbejderne "lever" et stærkt værdisæt, baseret på innovation, cirkulær økonomi og klimaaftryk, og har en ambition om at være den bedste arbejdsplads med frie og trygge rammer, understøttet af et højt kompetenceniveau og en stærk holdånd, og naturligvis med plads til frihed under ansvar.

Lead Instrument Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Instrument Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Instrument Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Work activities will include both project and proposal work where both the technical approach and continuity must be aligned
Work activities for both projects and proposals will be executed across all phases of projects including Conceptual Studies; Basic; FEED; Detailed Design; Procurement through to Commissioning.
Projects and proposals are for process plant and facilities across the Power and Energy Transition/ New Energy sectors
Project work will include development of Instrument Engineering deliverables as required on a project by project basis
Project work as the functional Lead Engineer for projects as required by the C&I Group Manager


Degree qualified for the related discipline
Chartered Engineer status as a Member of the Institute of Measurement and Control (IMC) or Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).
20+ years’ experience Instrument Engineering
5 + years’ experience in a Lead role on capital projects from concept to start-up
Experience of working in a client facing large project group environment
Very good proactive communicator.
Experienced at controlling man-hour budgets and scheduled delivery
Proven ability for equipment specification and selection and in ensuring compliance from the suppliers, preferably within an EPC contracting organization
Is this Lead Instrument Engineer position a good fit for you? Get in touch with us today.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Eats | Aarhus, Denmark
Description:
About the Role
Whether it's a sandwich, a burrito, or groceries, the Uber Eats team builds technology to connect people with what they want, when and where they want it. The Eats Engineering team in Denmark is responsible for building the product catalog and inventory system that powers the Uber Eats experience and related verticals, such as groceries. This is one of the foundational components of the Eats architecture, as it interfaces with merchants, powers our local graph, and serves recommendations to our customers. The system is designed to be highly-available and highly-scalable to support our global operation.
What You'll Do
Sr Staff engineers at Uber have a deep impact across a wide variety of business and technology decisions spanning multiple projects and locations. They are passionate and pragmatic technologists who are able to design, implement and deliver scalable and resilient systems. They are not only collaborative role models, but also approachable leaders within a larger group. They are humble teachers, technically mentoring a team of dedicated engineers while also delivering uniquely challenging projects.

Description:
The security organization at Uber is dedicated to enabling safe and secure innovation while protecting the communities we serve both online and in the physical world. Our teams are responsible for protecting both people and their data across intersections of the digital and physical world. The primary objective for Uber Engineering Security team is to enable the technical ambitions of the company while maintaining the highest standards of security and privacy for our customers and partners. As cybersecurity threats evolve, so do we.
About the Role
Uber is seeking a Software Engineer II to join our Vulnerability Platform team. As a member of our team you will help us scale the traditional model of finding infrastructure vulnerabilities manually to a fully automated and autonomous system. In this role, you will be tasked with designing, implementing and deploying security automation solutions responsible for orchestration of vulnerability management workflows on all Uber’s infrastructure assets. As a Software Engineer on the Vulnerability Platform team you’ll leverage your SWE skills and security expertise to raise the security bar across production and enterprise environments at Uber. This is a unique opportunity to work with both senior and new-grad engineers, make a real impact on Uber’s security posture, and continue to up-level your own software engineering and security skills.

Job_title: Sr Software Engineer, Stateful Container Management
Description:
About the Role
We build Uber’s infrastructure to deploy and run all database engines and other stateful systems such as MySQL, Schemaless, Redis, ZooKeeper, Kafka and HDFS globally for all of Uber worldwide. Our mission is to run all Uber's storage solutions at scale, with high-availability, low cost, and high level of automation. All changes are automated (or self-healing) such as doing kernel upgrades, handling host failures or expanding storage clusters.

A Bit About Us
We manage around 100,000 hosts, millions of containers and exabytes of storage across multiple geographical regions with availability zones in both Uber’s own data centers and multiple cloud vendors. Databases are dockerized and co-located on hosts with intelligent placement to optimize utilization and failure domain anti-affinity to maximize efficiency and reliability. Services are written in Go with a strong focus on clean, readable code with unit and integration test coverage. All code changes are peer-reviewed.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Fleet Reliability and Performance
Description:
About the Role
We build the foundations for all of Uber’s fleet of 100,000s of hosts or VMs by ensuring they are running optimally and are configured efficiently for the container platforms using the hosts. We observe and detect a broad range of reliability and quality problems through codified processes and automatically drive remediation.

We run generically across bare metal hosts and VMs and across our own on-prem data centers and multiple cloud vendors, and closely collaborate to develop integrations that ensure effective and automated management.

Internally we integrate with Uber’s stateful and stateless container scheduling platforms to run host operations in a safe and efficient way and use this to realize remediation of bad hosts or apply fleet-wide upgrades such as rolling out a new kernel.

Description:
Arla is on a journey to develop our digital platforms and solution to contribute to Supply Chain Strategy. We are insourcing IT competences in Dairy Train. Joining Arla IT Solutions, you become part of a company that is known for our use of agile processes, our internal collaboration, and our ability to deliver IT solutions that add value to our end-users.

Welcome to Arla
Arla is a global farmer-owned company that is behind many well-known brands, including Arla Apetina®, Castello®, Lurpak® and many, many more. As a Senior Developer you become a part of our Dairy ART Train within IT Supply Chain Department. Here, you won’t find factory, machines, or farmers. Instead, you will join over 60 of colleagues dedicated to supporting Arla with OT environment and production standardization with digitalization solution portfolio. Joining us, you will take part in our mission to make a real difference for colleagues near and far.

Job_title: Entry Software Engineer - Aarhus or Gdansk
Description:
We are looking for dedicated data engineers for our data platform teams within the Analytics powerhouse in Arla Foods. Join us and help us build and evolve Arla Foods data and analytics platform.

About the Job
You will become part of Arla Analytics Powerhouse (APH) where we deliver data and advanced analytics across Arla’s value chain and enable our colleagues to utilize data. You will work together with either our core platform team responsible for our cloud based data platform or the team working on the analytical services around the platform. Your skills and knowledge will support the development of components and solutions supporting our data and analytics platform. Specific tasks could be to develop a self-service ingestion framework with a simple UI for the business, building monitoring solutions for the running data pipelines, or building our MLOps component. In this job, you are cooperating with engineers, architects and product owners to continuously improve our platform capabilities and explore new functionalities.

Description:
Are you a Data Engineer who is ready to challenge yourself in using state-of-the-art technology to democratize e-commerce and create more technological equality?
Custimy is on the mission to create the Next-Generation Customer Data Platform for all. We are building the right infrastructural software required to activate valuable customer data for everyone. And, by everyone, we mean to empower smaller E-commerce businesses to have the same opportunities as larger ones for customer attention, acquisition and loyalty.
To support our rocket growth, we’re looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our fast-paced and exciting engineering team. You will become an integral part of shaping our Development team, focused on creating the next generation Customer Data Platform. As we are still a new company you will have a lot of impact on the development and the success journey of our start-up.

Job_title: Student Assistant- Digital Services for COWI in Lyngby, Denmark
Description:
Application deadline: 09 May 2023 - Denmark - Location: Lyngby - Digital

Student Assistant- Digital Services for COWI in Lyngby, Denmark
Lyngby

Do you want to be a part of a leading international consulting company that creates value and solutions to some of the most complex issues worldwide? Are you a Engineer looking to advance your career in Digital services? Then this is the place to apply your knowledge and curiosity to enable a better tomorrow.

Create Solutions that will enable a better tomorrow
The digital services role involves taking digitization initiatives and ensuring implementation in the department, as well as establishing and maintaining a standardized digital understanding.
We are looking for a student with a solid business understanding and interest in IT, digitalization, and technology. No matter your professional background, skills like coordination talent, cross-disciplinary collaboration, tech curiosity and the ability to handle many different activities simultaneously are key.


Labelling of ground truth for AI purposes.
Quality assessment for AI predictions
Labelling of plates and faces in panoramic images
Quality assessment of calibration test data for our 360 degrees cameras
Quality assessment of color corrections after applying them to the images
Quality assessment of hosted images during the campaign
Archiving (data prep, data queuing, overview of progress, and final cleanup on the server)
Hardware help

We highly value our students and view them as aspiring future experts; We expect that you can work at the office approximately two days a week as appropriate with your education schedule.
COWI is a leader within our field because our employees are leaders within theirs. We invite you to learn from the best and expand your potential in an outstanding environment, where we collaborate on shaping tomorrow's societies. Alongside your manager, you outline the path for your development and build your expertise on a day-to-day basis, working on global and local assignments.

Your skills. Our team. Together we design the future.
The first step to success in this role is that you are eager to collaborate with the people around you, whether they are colleagues, partners, or customers. Developing ties with others is something you do by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve. To succeed in this position, we believe that you should be a team player with curiosity, courage, and care.


Good verbal and written communication skills in English.
Interest in a creating a career in technology
Interest or knowledge of Python and SQL scripting

A place to work and so much more
At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity – and sometimes even our courage – to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100 per cent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.
We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.
With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America, and India, we are currently 7,300 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy, and environment into play.

Got more questions?

Get to know us even better at our website, www.cowi.com, where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.

Equal opportunity employer

In addition to federal law requirements, COWI complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Description:
ViaBill operates at the intersection of the eCommerce, payments and consumer credit sectors, and is an industry pioneer and early market entrant in the BNPL industry, which is experiencing rapid growth. Becoming the best at something isn’t easy. It takes skill, hard work, and an unmatched level of ambition and determination. Our team is international, experienced and most of all, hardworking. In just a few years, we’ve grown from our first office in an art gallery in Denmark to having our teams located all over the globe.
From a handful of customers to handling transactions worth more than $150M per year, we aren’t afraid of new challenges and new markets. Our strategy has been validated with external investment from leading VCs Headline and BlackFin Capital Partners.

About The Role

Job_title: Entry Data Platform Engineer - Aarhus or Gdansk
Description:
We are looking for dedicated data engineers for our data platform teams within the Analytics powerhouse in Arla Foods. Join us and help us build and evolve Arla Foods data and analytics platform.

About the Job
You will become part of Arla Analytics Powerhouse (APH) where we deliver data and advanced analytics across Arla’s value chain and enable our colleagues to utilize data. You will work together with either our core platform team, responsible for our cloud based data platform or the team working on the analytical services around the platform. Your skills and knowledge will support the work being done on the platforms and to build up new components and solutions. Specific tasks could be to setup CI/CD pipelines with automated tests, building deployments pipelines utilizing airflow or working on our data catalog component. In this position, you are cooperating with engineers, architects and product owners to continuously improve our platform capabilities and explore new functionalities. Our platform is built as a combination of Azure services and data bricks platform, and we are building supporting solutions around it, e.g. self-service ingestion.

Job_title: Data Engineers and Data Analysts for Copenhagen
Description:
Data Engineers & Data Analysts
My client is known to go above and beyond to help organizations to start using Artificial Intelligence, Analytics, and Data. They have even developed their own AlaaS platform that gives consumers the edge through the power of data-driven insights.
Here you will be surrounded by other Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Front end Developers and you will be part of a start-up mentality with agile ways of working. Teamwork is seen all over the office and always leads to delivering success.
My client is now looking for new talents to join the team. They are looking for someone with experience in building data warehouse infrastructure in Cloud and someone that understands the data mesh concept. My client has multiple data sources that need to be converted into data models, connected to each other, and provided for both visual tools like Power BI, and advanced analytics like Machine Learning, and also made available for consumption via API´s.

Description:
Make your ability count at NNE
We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you want to work on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.
Work with us
Do you work with cloud services, have you used CDK and are familiar with CI/CD pipelines? Is programming like second nature to you? Does building real-time data connectivity pipelines supporting advanced analytics pique your interest? Would you like to improve your skills in building cloud-based applications in AWS or Azure/Databricks? Then join our Manufacturing Intelligence team in Copenhagen and become our next Consultant within Cloud- and Data Engineering!

NNE Manufacturing Intelligence is a full-service provider of intelligence solutions within pharma manufacturing. We work with all aspects of data engineering/data science from cloud services, consultancy services, design, implementation, test/validation, and data analytics, machine learning to AI. Our specialty is data connectivity solutions for Pharma manufacturing, that enable data-driven decision-making, automation of processes and faster access to critical production data.



We are looking for an experienced data engineer or recent graduate with relevant work experience, who is outgoing, curious and engaged, and holds high ambitions for ensuring great quality in own work, and a willingness to share and learn from your peers. You will be asked to contribute, from day one, to our growing team of diverse Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

Your role as a Consultant in Manufacturing Intelligence will be to develop, test and implement the next generation of cloud solutions for pharma manufacturing environments. Collaborate with customers to turn ideas into value adding solutions and supporting them in every step of the way from design to implementation; and lastly, you will be a part of the project teams and participate on equal terms with your 50+ committed colleagues in Denmark and India.

We offer colleagues with pharma domain knowledge that can further advance your cloud skills within this field, along with hundreds of years of experience in pharma engineering.

Description:
Lead Instrument Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Instrument Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Instrument Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Work activities will include both project and proposal work where both the technical approach and continuity must be aligned
Work activities for both projects and proposals will be executed across all phases of projects including Conceptual Studies; Basic; FEED; Detailed Design; Procurement through to Commissioning.
Projects and proposals are for process plant and facilities across the Power and Energy Transition/ New Energy sectors
Project work will include development of Instrument Engineering deliverables as required on a project by project basis
Project work as the functional Lead Engineer for projects as required by the C&I Group Manager


Degree qualified for the related discipline
Chartered Engineer status as a Member of the Institute of Measurement and Control (IMC) or Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).
20+ years’ experience Instrument Engineering
5 + years’ experience in a Lead role on capital projects from concept to start-up
Experience of working in a client facing large project group environment
Very good proactive communicator.
Experienced at controlling man-hour budgets and scheduled delivery
Proven ability for equipment specification and selection and in ensuring compliance from the suppliers, preferably within an EPC contracting organization
Is this Lead Instrument Engineer position a good fit for you? Get in touch with us today.

The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert.

Please note, Quanta part of QCS Staffing does not sponsor Visa applications.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Eats | Aarhus, Denmark
Description:
About the Role
Whether it's a sandwich, a burrito, or groceries, the Uber Eats team builds technology to connect people with what they want, when and where they want it. The Eats Engineering team in Denmark is responsible for building the product catalog and inventory system that powers the Uber Eats experience and related verticals, such as groceries. This is one of the foundational components of the Eats architecture, as it interfaces with merchants, powers our local graph, and serves recommendations to our customers. The system is designed to be highly-available and highly-scalable to support our global operation.
What You'll Do
Sr Staff engineers at Uber have a deep impact across a wide variety of business and technology decisions spanning multiple projects and locations. They are passionate and pragmatic technologists who are able to design, implement and deliver scalable and resilient systems. They are not only collaborative role models, but also approachable leaders within a larger group. They are humble teachers, technically mentoring a team of dedicated engineers while also delivering uniquely challenging projects.

Description:
The security organization at Uber is dedicated to enabling safe and secure innovation while protecting the communities we serve both online and in the physical world. Our teams are responsible for protecting both people and their data across intersections of the digital and physical world. The primary objective for Uber Engineering Security team is to enable the technical ambitions of the company while maintaining the highest standards of security and privacy for our customers and partners. As cybersecurity threats evolve, so do we.
About the Role
Uber is seeking a Software Engineer II to join our Vulnerability Platform team. As a member of our team you will help us scale the traditional model of finding infrastructure vulnerabilities manually to a fully automated and autonomous system. In this role, you will be tasked with designing, implementing and deploying security automation solutions responsible for orchestration of vulnerability management workflows on all Uber’s infrastructure assets. As a Software Engineer on the Vulnerability Platform team you’ll leverage your SWE skills and security expertise to raise the security bar across production and enterprise environments at Uber. This is a unique opportunity to work with both senior and new-grad engineers, make a real impact on Uber’s security posture, and continue to up-level your own software engineering and security skills.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Stateful Fleet Management
Description:
About the Role
We build Uber’s infrastructure to deploy and run all database engines and other stateful systems globally. Our mission at Uber is to run all storage solutions at scale, with high availability, low cost, and a high level of automation. All changes are automated (or self-healing) such as doing kernel upgrades, handling host failures, or expanding storage clusters.
About Us
We run around 100,000 hosts, millions of containers, and exabytes of storage across multiple geographical regions with availability zones in both Uber’s own data centers and multiple cloud vendors. Databases are containerized and co-located on hosts with intelligent placement to optimize utilization and failure domain anti-affinity to improve efficiency and consistency. Services are written in Go and All code changes are peer-reviewed.

Job_title: Sr Software Engineer, Stateful Container Management
Description:
About the Role
We build Uber’s infrastructure to deploy and run all database engines and other stateful systems such as MySQL, Schemaless, Redis, ZooKeeper, Kafka and HDFS globally for all of Uber worldwide. Our mission is to run all Uber's storage solutions at scale, with high-availability, low cost, and high level of automation. All changes are automated (or self-healing) such as doing kernel upgrades, handling host failures or expanding storage clusters.

A Bit About Us
We manage around 100,000 hosts, millions of containers and exabytes of storage across multiple geographical regions with availability zones in both Uber’s own data centers and multiple cloud vendors. Databases are dockerized and co-located on hosts with intelligent placement to optimize utilization and failure domain anti-affinity to maximize efficiency and reliability. Services are written in Go with a strong focus on clean, readable code with unit and integration test coverage. All code changes are peer-reviewed.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Fleet Reliability and Performance
Description:
About the Role
We build the foundations for all of Uber’s fleet of 100,000s of hosts or VMs by ensuring they are running optimally and are configured efficiently for the container platforms using the hosts. We observe and detect a broad range of reliability and quality problems through codified processes and automatically drive remediation.

We run generically across bare metal hosts and VMs and across our own on-prem data centers and multiple cloud vendors, and closely collaborate to develop integrations that ensure effective and automated management.

Internally we integrate with Uber’s stateful and stateless container scheduling platforms to run host operations in a safe and efficient way and use this to realize remediation of bad hosts or apply fleet-wide upgrades such as rolling out a new kernel.

Description:
Arla is on a journey to develop our digital platforms and solution to contribute to Supply Chain Strategy. We are insourcing IT competences in Dairy Train. Joining Arla IT Solutions, you become part of a company that is known for our use of agile processes, our internal collaboration, and our ability to deliver IT solutions that add value to our end-users.

Welcome to Arla
Arla is a global farmer-owned company that is behind many well-known brands, including Arla Apetina®, Castello®, Lurpak® and many, many more. As a Senior Developer you become a part of our Dairy ART Train within IT Supply Chain Department. Here, you won’t find factory, machines, or farmers. Instead, you will join over 60 of colleagues dedicated to supporting Arla with OT environment and production standardization with digitalization solution portfolio. Joining us, you will take part in our mission to make a real difference for colleagues near and far.

Description:
Are you a Data Engineer who is ready to challenge yourself in using state-of-the-art technology to democratize e-commerce and create more technological equality?
Custimy is on the mission to create the Next-Generation Customer Data Platform for all. We are building the right infrastructural software required to activate valuable customer data for everyone. And, by everyone, we mean to empower smaller E-commerce businesses to have the same opportunities as larger ones for customer attention, acquisition and loyalty.
To support our rocket growth, we’re looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our fast-paced and exciting engineering team. You will become an integral part of shaping our Development team, focused on creating the next generation Customer Data Platform. As we are still a new company you will have a lot of impact on the development and the success journey of our start-up.

Job_title: Entry Software Engineer - Aarhus or Gdansk
Description:
We are looking for dedicated data engineers for our data platform teams within the Analytics powerhouse in Arla Foods. Join us and help us build and evolve Arla Foods data and analytics platform.

About the Job
You will become part of Arla Analytics Powerhouse (APH) where we deliver data and advanced analytics across Arla’s value chain and enable our colleagues to utilize data. You will work together with either our core platform team responsible for our cloud based data platform or the team working on the analytical services around the platform. Your skills and knowledge will support the development of components and solutions supporting our data and analytics platform. Specific tasks could be to develop a self-service ingestion framework with a simple UI for the business, building monitoring solutions for the running data pipelines, or building our MLOps component. In this job, you are cooperating with engineers, architects and product owners to continuously improve our platform capabilities and explore new functionalities.

Job_title: Student Assistant- Digital Services for COWI in Lyngby, Denmark
Description:
Application deadline: 09 May 2023 - Denmark - Location: Lyngby - Digital

Student Assistant- Digital Services for COWI in Lyngby, Denmark
Lyngby

Do you want to be a part of a leading international consulting company that creates value and solutions to some of the most complex issues worldwide? Are you a Engineer looking to advance your career in Digital services? Then this is the place to apply your knowledge and curiosity to enable a better tomorrow.

Create Solutions that will enable a better tomorrow
The digital services role involves taking digitization initiatives and ensuring implementation in the department, as well as establishing and maintaining a standardized digital understanding.
We are looking for a student with a solid business understanding and interest in IT, digitalization, and technology. No matter your professional background, skills like coordination talent, cross-disciplinary collaboration, tech curiosity and the ability to handle many different activities simultaneously are key.


Labelling of ground truth for AI purposes.
Quality assessment for AI predictions
Labelling of plates and faces in panoramic images
Quality assessment of calibration test data for our 360 degrees cameras
Quality assessment of color corrections after applying them to the images
Quality assessment of hosted images during the campaign
Archiving (data prep, data queuing, overview of progress, and final cleanup on the server)
Hardware help

We highly value our students and view them as aspiring future experts; We expect that you can work at the office approximately two days a week as appropriate with your education schedule.
COWI is a leader within our field because our employees are leaders within theirs. We invite you to learn from the best and expand your potential in an outstanding environment, where we collaborate on shaping tomorrow's societies. Alongside your manager, you outline the path for your development and build your expertise on a day-to-day basis, working on global and local assignments.

Your skills. Our team. Together we design the future.
The first step to success in this role is that you are eager to collaborate with the people around you, whether they are colleagues, partners, or customers. Developing ties with others is something you do by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve. To succeed in this position, we believe that you should be a team player with curiosity, courage, and care.


Good verbal and written communication skills in English.
Interest in a creating a career in technology
Interest or knowledge of Python and SQL scripting

A place to work and so much more
At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity – and sometimes even our courage – to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100 per cent of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.
We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.
With offices primarily located in Scandinavia, the UK, North America, and India, we are currently 7,300 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy, and environment into play.

Got more questions?
If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please reach out to Michael Olesen, Head of Section mcol@cowi.com.
Get to know us even better at our website, www.cowi.com, where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.

Equal opportunity employer
COWI provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, COWI complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

ViaBill operates at the intersection of the eCommerce, payments and consumer credit sectors, and is an industry pioneer and early market entrant in the BNPL industry, which is experiencing rapid growth. Becoming the best at something isn’t easy. It takes skill, hard work, and an unmatched level of ambition and determination. Our team is international, experienced and most of all, hardworking. In just a few years, we’ve grown from our first office in an art gallery in Denmark to having our teams located all over the globe.
From a handful of customers to handling transactions worth more than $150M per year, we aren’t afraid of new challenges and new markets. Our strategy has been validated with external investment from leading VCs Headline and BlackFin Capital Partners.

Description:
Make your ability count at NNE
We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you want to work on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.
Work with us
Do you work with cloud services, have you used CDK and are familiar with CI/CD pipelines? Is programming like second nature to you? Does building real-time data connectivity pipelines supporting advanced analytics pique your interest? Would you like to improve your skills in building cloud-based applications in AWS or Azure/Databricks? Then join our Manufacturing Intelligence team in Copenhagen and become our next Consultant within Cloud- and Data Engineering!

NNE Manufacturing Intelligence is a full-service provider of intelligence solutions within pharma manufacturing. We work with all aspects of data engineering/data science from cloud services, consultancy services, design, implementation, test/validation, and data analytics, machine learning to AI. Our specialty is data connectivity solutions for Pharma manufacturing, that enable data-driven decision-making, automation of processes and faster access to critical production data.



We are looking for an experienced data engineer or recent graduate with relevant work experience, who is outgoing, curious and engaged, and holds high ambitions for ensuring great quality in own work, and a willingness to share and learn from your peers. You will be asked to contribute, from day one, to our growing team of diverse Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

Your role as a Consultant in Manufacturing Intelligence will be to develop, test and implement the next generation of cloud solutions for pharma manufacturing environments. Collaborate with customers to turn ideas into value adding solutions and supporting them in every step of the way from design to implementation; and lastly, you will be a part of the project teams and participate on equal terms with your 50+ committed colleagues in Denmark and India.

We offer colleagues with pharma domain knowledge that can further advance your cloud skills within this field, along with hundreds of years of experience in pharma engineering.

Description:
Teton is building technology that lets us all re-imagine the role of the healthcare worker.
The worldwide nursing shortage is currently crippling hospitals and care homes, and the new technologies will play a crucial role in saving the healthcare system from collapse. At Teton we operate differently than the traditional companies within the field, by having a relentless focus on the product and users and developing solutions in lightning speed. In 2 years, Teton has developed and commercialized a full fleshed AI product, used by health care worker everyday and covering more than 140 patient-rooms to date.

The job:
We are looking for a string engineer that is very organised, responsible, and creative, your code will be deployed to our fleet, being able to create solutions and also thoroughly validating them is key to this role.

We are Lightnovo, a start-up company established in 2019 and founded by DTU researchers Oleksii Ilchenko, Yurii Pilhun, and Anja Boisen. Our vision is to become the leading developer and provider of Raman spectroscopy and Raman microscopy solutions for research-grade, industrial and consumer applications.
We are looking for an experienced C++ Software Engineer to join our team for the full-time.
The ideal candidate is expected to be comfortable developing C++ Desktop Applications in Qt for Windows 10, being familiar with designing programs for controlling external hardware, able to debug both hardware and software.
Responsibilities:

Job_title: Entry Data Platform Engineer - Aarhus or Gdansk
Description:
We are looking for dedicated data engineers for our data platform teams within the Analytics powerhouse in Arla Foods. Join us and help us build and evolve Arla Foods data and analytics platform.

About the Job
You will become part of Arla Analytics Powerhouse (APH) where we deliver data and advanced analytics across Arla’s value chain and enable our colleagues to utilize data. You will work together with either our core platform team, responsible for our cloud based data platform or the team working on the analytical services around the platform. Your skills and knowledge will support the work being done on the platforms and to build up new components and solutions. Specific tasks could be to setup CI/CD pipelines with automated tests, building deployments pipelines utilizing airflow or working on our data catalog component. In this position, you are cooperating with engineers, architects and product owners to continuously improve our platform capabilities and explore new functionalities. Our platform is built as a combination of Azure services and data bricks platform, and we are building supporting solutions around it, e.g. self-service ingestion.

Description:
Lead Instrument Engineer – Renewable Energy – Contract – Copenhagen

Are you a Lead Instrument Engineer looking for your next long-term contract? This is your chance to lead a major Power-to-X project utilising Hydrogen in Copenhagen!

Our client, a global provider of professional services in the energy, chemicals and resources sector are looking to onboard an experienced Instrument Engineer with a degree in engineering from April 2023. As the Project Manager, you will be a crucial contributor to the performance of the business unit. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a worldwide team of consultants, engineers, construction workers and data scientists on an initial 12-month contract.

The role consists of site work in Copenhagen, although some European travel is expected.


Work activities will include both project and proposal work where both the technical approach and continuity must be aligned
Work activities for both projects and proposals will be executed across all phases of projects including Conceptual Studies; Basic; FEED; Detailed Design; Procurement through to Commissioning.
Projects and proposals are for process plant and facilities across the Power and Energy Transition/ New Energy sectors
Project work will include development of Instrument Engineering deliverables as required on a project by project basis
Project work as the functional Lead Engineer for projects as required by the C&I Group Manager


Degree qualified for the related discipline
Chartered Engineer status as a Member of the Institute of Measurement and Control (IMC) or Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).
20+ years’ experience Instrument Engineering
5 + years’ experience in a Lead role on capital projects from concept to start-up
Experience of working in a client facing large project group environment
Very good proactive communicator.
Experienced at controlling man-hour budgets and scheduled delivery
Proven ability for equipment specification and selection and in ensuring compliance from the suppliers, preferably within an EPC contracting organization
Is this Lead Instrument Engineer position a good fit for you? Get in touch with us today.

The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Eats | Aarhus, Denmark
Description:
About the Role
Whether it's a sandwich, a burrito, or groceries, the Uber Eats team builds technology to connect people with what they want, when and where they want it. The Eats Engineering team in Denmark is responsible for building the product catalog and inventory system that powers the Uber Eats experience and related verticals, such as groceries. This is one of the foundational components of the Eats architecture, as it interfaces with merchants, powers our local graph, and serves recommendations to our customers. The system is designed to be highly-available and highly-scalable to support our global operation.
What You'll Do
Sr Staff engineers at Uber have a deep impact across a wide variety of business and technology decisions spanning multiple projects and locations. They are passionate and pragmatic technologists who are able to design, implement and deliver scalable and resilient systems. They are not only collaborative role models, but also approachable leaders within a larger group. They are humble teachers, technically mentoring a team of dedicated engineers while also delivering uniquely challenging projects.

Description:
The security organization at Uber is dedicated to enabling safe and secure innovation while protecting the communities we serve both online and in the physical world. Our teams are responsible for protecting both people and their data across intersections of the digital and physical world. The primary objective for Uber Engineering Security team is to enable the technical ambitions of the company while maintaining the highest standards of security and privacy for our customers and partners. As cybersecurity threats evolve, so do we.
About the Role
Uber is seeking a Security Engineer II to join our Product Security Team. In this role your principal mission will be to drive security-related engineering engagement and technical remediation across our product lines, supporting our vulnerability management, application security, and cloud security teams to scale security engagement across Engineering.

The security organization at Uber is dedicated to enabling safe and secure innovation while protecting the communities we serve both online and in the physical world. The primary objective for Uber Engineering Security team is to enable the technical ambitions of the company while maintaining the highest standards of security and privacy for our customers and partners. As cybersecurity threats evolve, so do we.
About the Role
Uber is seeking a Software Engineer II to join our Vulnerability Platform team. As a member of our team you will help us scale the traditional model of finding infrastructure vulnerabilities manually to a fully automated and autonomous system. In this role, you will be tasked with designing, implementing and deploying security automation solutions responsible for orchestration of vulnerability management workflows on all Uber’s infrastructure assets. As a Software Engineer on the Vulnerability Platform team you’ll leverage your SWE skills and security expertise to raise the security bar across production and enterprise environments at Uber. This is a unique opportunity to work with both senior and new-grad engineers, make a real impact on Uber’s security posture, and continue to up-level your own software engineering and security skills.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Stateful Fleet Management
Description:
About the Role
We build Uber’s infrastructure to deploy and run all database engines and other stateful systems globally. Our mission at Uber is to run all storage solutions at scale, with high availability, low cost, and a high level of automation. All changes are automated (or self-healing) such as doing kernel upgrades, handling host failures, or expanding storage clusters.
About Us
We run around 100,000 hosts, millions of containers, and exabytes of storage across multiple geographical regions with availability zones in both Uber’s own data centers and multiple cloud vendors. Databases are containerized and co-located on hosts with intelligent placement to optimize utilization and failure domain anti-affinity to improve efficiency and consistency. Services are written in Go and All code changes are peer-reviewed.

Job_title: Sr Software Engineer, Stateful Container Management
Description:
About the Role
We build Uber’s infrastructure to deploy and run all database engines and other stateful systems such as MySQL, Schemaless, Redis, ZooKeeper, Kafka and HDFS globally for all of Uber worldwide. Our mission is to run all Uber's storage solutions at scale, with high-availability, low cost, and high level of automation. All changes are automated (or self-healing) such as doing kernel upgrades, handling host failures or expanding storage clusters.

A Bit About Us
We manage around 100,000 hosts, millions of containers and exabytes of storage across multiple geographical regions with availability zones in both Uber’s own data centers and multiple cloud vendors. Databases are dockerized and co-located on hosts with intelligent placement to optimize utilization and failure domain anti-affinity to maximize efficiency and reliability. Services are written in Go with a strong focus on clean, readable code with unit and integration test coverage. All code changes are peer-reviewed.

Job_title: Staff Software Engineer, Fleet Reliability and Performance
Description:
About the Role
We build the foundations for all of Uber’s fleet of 100,000s of hosts or VMs by ensuring they are running optimally and are configured efficiently for the container platforms using the hosts. We observe and detect a broad range of reliability and quality problems through codified processes and automatically drive remediation.

We run generically across bare metal hosts and VMs and across our own on-prem data centers and multiple cloud vendors, and closely collaborate to develop integrations that ensure effective and automated management.

Internally we integrate with Uber’s stateful and stateless container scheduling platforms to run host operations in a safe and efficient way and use this to realize remediation of bad hosts or apply fleet-wide upgrades such as rolling out a new kernel.

Job_title: Software Engineer who likes Cloud Infrastructure and Data Engineering - Aarhus
Description:
Arla is on a journey to develop our digital platforms and solution to contribute to Supply Chain Strategy. We are insourcing IT competences in Dairy Train. Joining Arla IT Solutions, you become part of a company that is known for our use of agile processes, our internal collaboration, and our ability to deliver IT solutions that add value to our end-users.

Welcome to Arla
Arla is a global farmer-owned company that is behind many well-known brands, including Arla Apetina®, Castello®, Lurpak® and many, many more. As a Senior Developer you become a part of our Dairy ART Train within IT Supply Chain Department. Here, you won’t find factory, machines, or farmers. Instead, you will join over 60 of colleagues dedicated to supporting Arla with OT environment and production standardization with digitalization solution portfolio. Joining us, you will take part in our mission to make a real difference for colleagues near and far.

Description:
Are you a Data Engineer who is ready to challenge yourself in using state-of-the-art technology to democratize e-commerce and create more technological equality?
Custimy is on the mission to create the Next-Generation Customer Data Platform for all. We are building the right infrastructural software required to activate valuable customer data for everyone. And, by everyone, we mean to empower smaller E-commerce businesses to have the same opportunities as larger ones for customer attention, acquisition and loyalty.
To support our rocket growth, we’re looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our fast-paced and exciting engineering team. You will become an integral part of shaping our Development team, focused on creating the next generation Customer Data Platform. As we are still a new company you will have a lot of impact on the development and the success journey of our start-up.

Job_title: Entry Software Engineer - Aarhus or Gdansk
Description:
We are looking for dedicated data engineers for our data platform teams within the Analytics powerhouse in Arla Foods. Join us and help us build and evolve Arla Foods data and analytics platform.

About the Job
You will become part of Arla Analytics Powerhouse (APH) where we deliver data and advanced analytics across Arla’s value chain and enable our colleagues to utilize data. You will work together with either our core platform team responsible for our cloud based data platform or the team working on the analytical services around the platform. Your skills and knowledge will support the development of components and solutions supporting our data and analytics platform. Specific tasks could be to develop a self-service ingestion framework with a simple UI for the business, building monitoring solutions for the running data pipelines, or building our MLOps component. In this job, you are cooperating with engineers, architects and product owners to continuously improve our platform capabilities and explore new functionalities.
